everyoneShouldKnow: Very relaxing atmosphere.
title: Liked It A Lot
comment: We enjoyed our stay at this hotel immensely. The staff was friendly, courteous and eager to accomodate. Steven in the Coral Crab Cafe served us breakfast and dinner and did a great job. the shuttle drivers were cordial and helpful in recommending places to go. The housekeeping staff did a thorough job cleaning the room and did so quietly. The front desk staff was very pleasant, gracious and informative. We would absolutely stay at this hotel next time we are in Key West!!

everyoneShouldKnow: Unclean and in a bad location
title: Unacceptable
comment: Throughout the years we have stayed in many Grandbourne properties. We find it hard to believe that you have not upgraded this property. We were given no recognition for being Grandbourne members. Room location and room condition were horrible.

everyoneShouldKnow: Very Big, and when full, Crowded.
title: Lounge Disappoints
comment: The Hotel is very well situated and undergoing renovations. The Rooms are well maintained and effecient.

everyoneShouldKnow: Location
title: Nice staff & amenities. Just a bad room
comment: I have no qualms with this hotel. The staff was friendly upon check-in and answered my questions regarding the area. The room was comfortable including the bed. My issue was my room was just not the most clean nor the most well maintained. The floor was not filthy but a better once over with a vaccum would have been nice. Walls were severely scratched and the wall paper was peeling in places. Lighting fixtures were loose. Again, nothing can be perfect but the staff still was friendly.

title: Very friendly staff
comment: Room not quite ready when I went to check in -- staff gave my girls free chocolate milk, brought me the keys while I was waiting. Lounge great view looking uptown. Comfortable beds as usual for Belvoir.

everyoneShouldKnow: Keep your expectations in check. Sometimes this hotel is amazing, and sometimes anything but.
title: Not Bad, Not Great
comment: I've stayed at this hotel many times in the past year, and have a few stays booked already for this year.

everyoneShouldKnow: needs updating - older than it looks on the outside
title: Disappointing
comment: Club level was closed due to holiday - certificates issued for one breakfast (two night stay).

everyoneShouldKnow: Ease to the metro. Ask for a "cool" room.
title: The temperature in the room and hallway needs adjusted
comment: Our room was extremely hot and the temperature outside was in the 40s and 50s. I set the temperature to 60 the first night and it was uncomfortable all night for both of us. The next morning, I set the temp to 50 (as low as it would go) and put the fan on high. When we got back that night, the room was cool. It was hot on the third night and we mentioned it to a manager. They opened the windows but the room got hot again during the afternoon. We checked out 1 day early because of the heat. When we pulled out of the garage, we heard through the walkie talkie to get us out asap because we were complainers. The comment was made to us during our stay that others complained about the heat as well. This is not what I expect from Belvoir.

everyoneShouldKnow: for the location, service and food, it is a very good value, and would not hesitate to come back.
title: I will be back!!
comment: We stayed the week between Christmas and New Years. I think they were at capacity for obvious reasons. From the time we arrived to when we departed, the staff was cheerful and rooms were cleaned daily w fresh towels, water and coffee refilled. Any requests were taken care of with a smile. That impressed me the most as I have stayed at more higher end hotels and haven't received the service

everyoneShouldKnow: A hotel that the public needs to be more aware of, as it is great.
title: A very pleasant stay at the Belvoir, san Franciso
comment: I was very pleasantly surprised about the location and amenities of theBelvoir Fisherman's Wharf Hotel. It was within walking distance of many restaurants, attractions and stores. The hotel itself was really nice with regards to the room, the amenities, the staff. I would definitely stay there again and would highly recommend it.

everyoneShouldKnow: This hotel has everything that you could want. You feel like you are on holiday from the time you enter the lobby
title: Wonderful Holiday Experience
comment: This hotel has such a special feel.

everyoneShouldKnow: Friendly and helpful staff members
title: This hotel has helpful and friendly staff
comment: Belvoir Meadowlands in East Rutherford NJ USA has staff members (particularly, at the front desk) who are helpful and friendly. Also, the Club Room is very good.

everyoneShouldKnow: Wait until the renovations are completed before staying here.
title: Belvoir New York - still bad for golds
comment: When I checked in on Wed., I asked whether as a gold BPG member I would be able to have a renovated room. I was told that gold members did not receive any upgrade benefit at this hotel and I would receive the exact room I booked, which was an old tired exceedingly hot room on the 8th floor -didn't know I was booking this ;^} . However, if I wanted to pay for a renovated room, it would be $40/night. Whatever happened to the gold benefit of receiving an upgraded room at time of checkin if available - which one was since it was available for $40? I won't be staying here again until all of the rooms are renovated!

everyoneShouldKnow: The Disney package, getting your tickets and the shuttle are a big problem. Staff was not customer service oriented.
title: Very unorganized
comment: I purchased a package deal which included Disneyland tickets. I tried to check in at about 2:45 pm, but was told I couldn't check in until 3 pm and couldn't get my Disneyland tickets until I checked in. When I checked in at 3 pm one of my two rooms was not ready. I said, that's OK, we can put all our luggage in the 1st room, go to Disneyland and then check into the 2nd room when we get back. I was told I couldn't have the Disneyland tickets until the 2nd room was ready. I complained and was finally given the tickets. When we returned, we got the 2nd room. My daughter was going to take a shower and let us know the bathroom had no towels. It took about 15 minutes to get towels to our room. The shuttle to Disneyland is overcrowded and you are likely to have to wait to get back to the hotel. On one trip in to Disneyland the shuttle driver informed us he as not going back to Disneyland and we had to wait another 1/2 hour past the scheduled time. The rooms were fine, but the service and organization were not. It was like the hotel had just opened that day and they were working out the bugs. Problem is, it wasn't the first day.

everyoneShouldKnow: Bring money!
title: Sins of omission
comment: The staff failed to tell meal was included. Also the view nothing like the web site. Overall, nice, relaxing and welcoming. Thanks!

everyoneShouldKnow: great location - near stamford town center, and the train station for quick trip into NYC.
title: pleasantly surprised
comment: We were pleasantly surprised at the value and extras at this hotel. the front desk staff was excellent, efficient and very knowledgable about the area. They were able to make recos for dinner locations and the hotel offered a free shuttle for us which dropped us off on Bedford Street and picked us up several hours later all at no charge to us. The shuttle driver was very friendly and really enjoyed his job. The breakfast buffet was great. We will definitley be returning to this hotel again - it was a great value and the staff really went out of their way to meet all our needs.

everyoneShouldKnow: Convenient location, but don't expect a clean, modern look until they go through a renovation. And by all means, lock your valuables in the safe.
title: Needs a Facelift and Better Security
comment: I stayed with my family on the way home from visiting family with a quick detour to Hershey. My BPG status was acknowledged and I received a room upgrade at check-in. Things I observed: 1. there was no hotel key card required to enter through the rear hotel entrance; 2. one of the washcloths in our bathroom had some old stain that didn't bleach out; 3. children under 16 are not allowed into the BPG club room, which is annoying for those members traveling with families; to be fair, they did offer a voucher for breakfast at the restaurant, but still odd as no other hotel has refused entry to the club room for children. Perhaps most concerning, though, was the knock on the door in the morning from some middle-aged women claiming to be housekeeping and holding what looked like a key card (a master perhaps) while still wearing a coat and carrying a handbag. I can't say that made me feel all that safe, and though I reported it to the front desk, they never called back to report on what they found.

everyoneShouldKnow: Great location but needs work
title: I wanted to like it, but .......
comment: Great location -- right at the 16th street mall and we were upgraded to a beautiful suite (platinum on an award stay). Great health club in the tower.

everyoneShouldKnow: Charges for parking and internet are not included in room rate.
title: Decent value for money
comment: Positives: Great access to disney parks - the shuttle service was very good, access to park early hours worked out extremely well. Outdoor pool was very nice - had a water slide and 3 different pools.

title: Exceptional concierge buffet
comment: All of the staff were extremely helpful. The food on the concierge floor was displayed perfectly and the variety of food available was really impressive. BPG members will be well taken care of.

everyoneShouldKnow: Overnight Parking charge
title: Not what I expected
comment: I went to this hotel for a romantic New Years Eve getaway with my fiance and was utterly dissappointed. We frequently stay at another Belvoir hotel but wanted to try this one out for the special occassion thinking it would be nicer. To begin they did not give us a suite upgrade which is required at all Belvoir hotels because I am a platinum member. They said we could still use the Club suite so I thought ok I will deal with it. From the time we got off of the elevator we smelled a horrible musk smell and the hallway looked more like a motel than a nice hotel. The top problem was that we were obviously on a floor with all dogs. For starters I did not know dogs were even allowed in the hotel! We had constant barking all night long and morning! So much for my romantic getaway... The bathroom needed to be remolded terribly bad and the most disgusting part of the room was the nasty floor. The carpet was soiled, stained and spotted so bad that I did not dare take off my shoes while walking around. I wanted to cry! I will never stay at this hotel again it was the worst New Year's Eve ever!

everyoneShouldKnow: Location is excellent
title: Good Location, Parking Issues
comment: Hotel convenient, and staff was excellent.

title: Great room for the price
comment: Not exactly sure why all the earlier negative reviews. Was a little hesitant to stay here for that reason but glad my wife and I did. Everyone was extremely helpful from the moment we checked in. Complimentary shuttle because of the location to Sundance was quick. Starbucks made a mistake on my wife's coffee and the hotel ran another to the room within 5 minutes. No train noise in the south tower although my friend reported a little in the north. It was as quality a stay as I have had in a Grandbourne property.

everyoneShouldKnow: Friendly staff
title: Our "Go To" Hotel in Myrtle Beach
comment: We stay at this hotel 2-3 times a year. We enjoy that it is NOT on the beach but has a good view of the downtown area (including the new SkyWheel). The hotel almost always upgrades us (without being asked) to the club floor. The breakfast in the club lounge and evening snacks are OK. Could be better and could be worse. The attendant wasn't always in the club but came when called. On our last trip a problem with the sink drain was fixed quickly and well. Staff is friendly and helpful. We'll go back probably next fall. We DON'T go to MB in the summer. Too hot and too many people.

everyoneShouldKnow: Everything!
title: Simply Awesome!
comment: I stayed here prior to a cruise with my Mom! The hotel was great from check-in to check-out! The Managers of every Grandbourne Hotel should work here and take that knowledge back with them to their own hotel!

everyoneShouldKnow: The Great Customer Service
title: This Hotel is Great
comment: We want to say thank you to all the staffs at the Belvoir Gateway who were working so hard this weekend. It was so great to see a smile when being greeted no matter what time it was. We stay only at the Belvoir Gateway when we are in Los Angeles. This hotel meet our expectation as what a home away from home should be. It's clean and organized. Happy New Year Belvoir Gateway LAX Staff.

title: What an escape!
comment: I would live here if I could. The hotel owns the beach which looks like it's 100 acres! The rooms are wonderful, and don't get me started about the fine-dining restaurant Rusty's Bistro. Mouth-watering food every night. The manager (Darla, I think?) couldn't be more accomodating and friendly.

everyoneShouldKnow: Staff here is the best.
title: Great Staff
comment: The location, staff, and rooms are very nice. The BPG channel on the TV boasts a $2billion investment in their hotels. They need to update the elevators and plumbing in this building.

everyoneShouldKnow: Poor Service - DO NOT pay for Club Level - not worth it, at all.
title: Club Level Way, Way below expectations
comment: I paid $30 extra to get a room on Club Level for my family. The breakfast was complete chaos - overcrowded, huge lines, and no staff for a sustained 30 minutes with no attendant, no refill of food, no plates, and lots of unhappy people.

everyoneShouldKnow: The lobby
title: A classy classic
comment: The Gunter is an historic hotel that lives up to expectations and reputation. Beautiful on the inside. Our room was up-to-date, spacious, clean and comfortable. Great rate and value for the price. -- DCK

title: Nice features, no bar
comment: This hotel was really nice overall. The location is a lot quieter than the main hotel and the views are amazing.

everyoneShouldKnow: The staff is excellent
title: Great Staff
comment: I have family in town and have stayed here 7 or 8 times in the last year or so. Every time the staff has been extremely friendly, upgraded me to a suite, made sure I have club access or breakfast coupons, responded to requests immediately, etc. This is an old hotel, so the rooms are nothing special, but comfortable and in my experience quiet. The location is excellent - you can walk to the major downtown Indy attractions. I've walked to the monuments and the Pacers game from here, as well as multiple restaurants. The club is above average. Parking is convenient. As a platinum I could go elsewhere but I like this place and keep coming back.

everyoneShouldKnow: Parking is in a dirt lot (and costs $22).
title: Highly Disapointing
comment: I was incredibly disappointed with my stay. While the room was nice and clean there were two large issues that I felt were not up to the standards of a Belvoir Hotel.

everyoneShouldKnow: If something is not right with your room, ASK they will fix it.
title: Great Hotel For Any Tampa Stay
comment: Our first impression of the hotel held true throughtout our 3 night stay. The lobby and atruim were very pleasant to look at and relax in. We were at this hotel from 12/31/11until 1/3/12. The rooms were clean, comfortable and updated. The beds were comfortable and we slept very well. Considering one of the nights was New Year's Eve and we had many band students in the hotel, it was still quiet and comfortable. Kudos to the Band kids. Very well behaved young people!! Eat in St. James Restuarant, the food is very good and the prices are not typical of hotel of this caliber. Smoked Salmon Egss Benedict YUM!!!!!!

everyoneShouldKnow: Don't expect a staff catering to your needs.
title: Expected More
comment: We had a lot of problems sorting out room issues with the staff. Although polite enough to discuss with, the overall experience was not something I would want to repeat.

everyoneShouldKnow: peaceful and quiet - not in the thick of party. Huge big beach.
title: Belvoir Sand Key
comment: We were absolutely thrilled with the Sand Key from the moment Daniel and I arrived. The staff, without exception, were attentive, helpful, cheerful and delightful to deal with.

everyoneShouldKnow: Bad service
title: Rudest Grandbournes property Ive been to.
comment: As a BPG gold member Ive been to quite a bit of properties around the country. This hotel by far has the ABSOLUTE rudest staff you could imagine. I'm talking top to bottom, from the check-in staff-who told me at 1230 my room should be ready shortly, then told my wife at 3 that the room wasnt ready,only to reverse course and give us a key to a room, to the CLUB Lounge, to the the Pelican Bar- bartenders to the, Concierge-Who, when I asked for a Restaurant phone number, I was told "you can look it up." I was absolutley baffled.

everyoneShouldKnow: Fine food and golf - below average courtesy and hospitality.
title: Fine food and Golf - absent courtesy and hospitality
comment: First, the good - the food at the restaurants - even the grill at the adjacent golf courses is terrific.

title: Decent, Enjoyable Place, Needs Minor Improvements
comment: Overall, I had a decent stay at the Wild Horse Pass Resort. Most of the staff were very friendly and helpful. We did have to switch rooms due to a loud noise in the bathroom pipes, but that happens from time to time. My major concern is with the shuttles and transportations they offered on the resort. They have a boat that takes you to the Rawhide location, however it is controlled by an independent party. The staff failed to tell me how unreliable the boat was and I unfortunately had to wait over an hour for a boat that never appeared at their resort. None of the front desk seemed to really care about my misfortune. Luckily, a manager there was very concerned and offered a listening ear. The restaurants were great and the facility offers a peaceful vibe. The pools were nice to have even though the jacuzzi could have been warmer in temperature. The business center had plenty of workstations to use from. My only other minor concerns are the location of the fitness center (it appeared there's a charge to use it???) and no vending machines for a late night soda. Rather to pay $2.50 for a glass of coke, we decided to drive into town and get a 99 cent 2 liter.

everyoneShouldKnow: Get parking pass inside so you don't have to pay for self parking hourly.
title: great hotel and friendly workers
comment: I booked this hotel for an event at the Anaheim convention Center. Usually you aren't supposed to check in until 4PM but when I called them at 1PM the room was free and I was able to check in earlier.

everyoneShouldKnow: Great Location
title: Great Location & Comfort
comment: This hotel is in the best location for Boston - amidst exciting Back Bay, and it provides excellent service, comfortable rooms, and responsive staff. We return to this hotel quite often - it is our first choice in the Boston area - this time we had a problem with the shower not working. A quick phone call to guest service yielded a very competent mechanic who promptly fixed the problem. My gold BPG status afforded us an upgrade and late checkout, which were wonderful for New Year's weekend.

title: Exceeded Expectations
comment: This hotel is in an ideal Iowa City location. And while that alone would make it a solid choice, it was the facility itself that was perfect for our group. It was very clean and the staff was excellent. We will be back and hopefully soon.

everyoneShouldKnow: Do NOT have a room near the service door and when the hotel says they will do somethings specific to make your stay nice, they won't
title: Fell Very Short of Expectations
comment: Being a long BPG member, my expectatinos are only as high as other BPG properties have made them. The Belvoir NY Toweers and Hotel fell very short to fullfilling any of the promises they said they would do when making a reservations. Very disappointed. Being my first time at this property, it may very well be my last.

title: Disappointed
comment: I was disappointed that there wasn't parking available at the hotel. We had to park across the street and walk over. Not easy to do when carrying several bags. The front desk staff was rude and not very helpful. They could not tell me where the ice machine was on my floor. I stayed in the presidential suite and they also could not provide directions on how to get to the breakfast room on the 12th floor.

title: Great experience
comment: We were very impressed overall with this hotel, from the beautiful lobby atrium to the helpful and courteous staff. Room was very clean, spacious and comfortable. We would recommend this hotel highly to anyone staying in the Tampa area.

everyoneShouldKnow: Just Rennovated everything is new made stay awesome
title: Great New Year
comment: Family wanted to do something different for New Year's and we choose here. We made the right choice. Room was great staff was super and all facilities were awesome.

everyoneShouldKnow: Doesn't recognize BPG Platinum status
title: No BPG Recognition At This Hotel
comment: For my very first business trip to New York City, I I decided to choose this property based on my Platinum BPG status and the benefits that accompany that status.

everyoneShouldKnow: This hotel is very dated and a 30 minute bus ride to Magic Kingdom.
title: A complete disappointment
comment: This hotel needs a complete remodel, which appears to be getting started now. The rooms are dated and furnishings are not comfortable. We only stayed for 3 days and the house keeping staff woke us up everyday by 8:00 to ask if we were checking out or if they could clean the room. The restaurants are decent but nothing great. Also, this hotel is a 30 minute bus ride to Magic Kingdom... it's technically on Disney property but there are a lot of places that are closer. If you are going to Epcot the water taxi is great and only a short 10 minute ride.

title: Nice hotel
comment: This hotel was really nice and the rooms were great. The one complaint I had was that someone had vomitted in the hallway around 9:00 pm and we called the front desk and told them. Two gentlemen came and poured powder on it and swept it up a little bit, but that was it. The pile of powder and chunks remained in the hallway even when I left the hotel at noon the next day. The smell was horrific all night and the following day. My daughter ended up getting the 24 hr flu and so did my sister in law. I would assume that it was from constantly breathing in odor from the vomit that was not cleaned up in the hallway.

title: Not the BPG I Know
comment: When I checked in I was given a room on the first floor directly next to an elevator. I stay at Grandbourne hotels fairly often so I do not understand why the person working gave me this room. This turned into a disaster as this was the loudest room (on NYE especially so). I asked to transfer rooms but was told that there was no availablility. When my fiancee and I were headed to dinner there were a group of teenagers were in front of the main entrance smoking marijuana - our cab driver told the front desk who didnt seem to care. On top of all of that, the internet connection and television was terrible - spotty at best. This stay makes me question why I go out of my way in business travel to stay at Grandbourne properties.

everyoneShouldKnow: It is within walking distance to Navy Pier and north Michigan Avenue.
title: New Years Eve stay
comment: Great place and resasonable rate for NYE stay if you want to walk to Navy Pier and see the fireworks at midnight. Access to North Michigan Avenue is excellent. If you want a quiet hotel though, this is not the place. The room walls are thin. As a Grandbourne Preferred guest I was treated well. I had to change my reservation at the last minute due to a booking error on my part and the front desk resolved it. The concierge changed my dinner reservation allowing my wife and I a later seating so we could see the fireworks from our dinner table. It was a memorable stay.

title: Great locale, don't book connecting room!
comment: Belvoir Boston Copley is in a great location in the city, attached to the Hynes Convention Center and in Coply Square. Check in was a breeze and we were assigned Room 2456 in the South Tower, a corner king. Typical comfortable Belvoir room, great view on the Grandbournes Floor. Our only issue started at 2:00 AM when our neighbors in 2457 returned. Being a connecting room, literally every sound could be heard. Being a holiday weekend I understand the revelry, but the lack of sound deadening between the rooms was unacceptable for a Belvoir.

everyoneShouldKnow: Great downtown location!
title: Great location!
comment: This hotel is perfectly, centrally located downtown. We spent New Year's Eve there and were able to get everywhere we wanted to go either by the free mall shuttle or on foot without having to walk far at all. Like most all Grandbourne properties, this Belvoir did not disappoint. We stayed in the Towers which is a much older building an though the rooms were spacious enough and well decorated, you could still feel the sense of an older city building. Overall I loved the location, pool area and as always the professional and helpful staff. I will go back again soon.

everyoneShouldKnow: Great service
title: Above our expectations!
comment: I booked our room rather last minute for NYE and was not expecting a very nice room nor very good service on such a busy date but WOW!! From the moment we checked in until we had to leave we were amazed at how beautiful the hotel is, how great our room was and more than anything how wonderful the employees were! I have never had a better experience and they were at capacity! We truly can't wait to come back and I hope when we do that we get to see Monique in the 18th floor club again! She provided the most pleasant experience ever and I know that she is the most valuable person to your organization!

everyoneShouldKnow: The staff are very professional and caring.
title: Holiday Stay
comment: I've stayed here a number of times. And although the hotel staff is wonderful, there were some shortcomings that could have been prevented. (1) I stayed in a suite, which I would never do again. Why? Because all the suites, I was told, are next to the elevator. And to make things worse, the bedroom is located adjacent to the elevator shaft. And worse yet, the bed's headboard abuts the elevator shaft wall so all you hear is the elevator going up and down until the wee hours of the morning. So if you are a light sleeper, you can forget about getting a good night's sleep. (2) The sofa in the suite is worn out, it's too deep and there are no pillows to rest against, making the sofa virtually impossible to really use comfortably. (3) the remote for the TV in the living room wouldn't work; had to request a new one and it took several attempts for housekeeping to bring one that would work. (4) I was given access to the lounge on the 16th floor, I assume because of my Gold Preferred Status. And on a few visits, the food wasn't being replenished and it required me having to call the front desk and being told to go to the restaurant for breakfast, albeit complimentary. (5) New Year's Eve was a debacle in the making. It was like a university's dormitory with all the noise that lasted until about 3am with kids being allowed to run up and down the hallways yelling at each other, doors repeatedly being slammed, etc. I called the front desk about it, they were sympathetic but obviously didn't have the ability to stop it. (6) then there was the couple in the adjacent room (locked door connecting our two rooms) who decided that everyone needed to hear them having relations at 2am with the woman reciting lines from a cheap adult movie for about 30 minutes. I'm only grateful that my 14 year old daughter wasn't staying with me at the time.

everyoneShouldKnow: Poor Service
title: Poor Service
comment: Very disappointed in this hotel, they refused to refund us for our stay when we had to cancel due to Hurricane Irene. Poor leadership and awful customer service seem to be typical of this independently owned Belvoir.

everyoneShouldKnow: Read the reviews
title: New Years Eve disappointment
comment: We live locally, but were enjoying a new years eve wedding downtown and decided to stay downtown to avoid driving and to have a little time to ourselves. Being a loyal BPG member and having had many enjoyable experiences at Grandbourne properties around the world, we choose the Belvoir and I was able to use BPG points...even better. I immediately was concerned as I checked in and had a very rude valet person. Whatever...it's new years eve and I am sure this young person does not want to be working, the staff that checked me in was very nice and even mentioned they upgraded me. When I arrived at my room there were two men that appeared to be replacing a television that was missing from the wall. I was just dropping off my bags and they assured me that they needed to get some brackets and would get a tv to hook up. We returned to the hotel late that night and I noticed a few things...one NO TV..two a mess around where there should be a tv.....and three NO note explaining why there is no tv. I called the front desk and got answer after many rings. What kind of upgrade is this? Wife and I were looking very forward to a little room service in the morning and a little TV....not something you ever get with little ones at home. I know this i seems small, the room was relatively clean outside of the mess from the people that were supposed to put the tv, the bed was not the sweet sleeper that they mentioned on the website when i signed up(another disappointment and misleading advertisement). We stayed here to expect Grandbourne quality (I have stayed in over 100 Grandbournes around the world) and this is not what was delivered. I am actually very disappointed I was charged for not getting what I signed up for. There are many great hotels in downtown fort worth and at least in this experience this did not live up to one of them.

title: Above My Expectations
comment: I was pleasantly surprised when I arrived at this location. It was just a stop over on my way to south Florida. It is was a good deal for the money and I travel with a small pet so I was glad to find a hotel that had reasonable rates and still a clean nice hotel. The staff was great and the room was very clean and comfortable. I stayed on the club level and the accomadation for breakfast were closed due to the holiday. I was given a voucher for the restuarant downstairs. No complaints from me and I would definitely stay here again

everyoneShouldKnow: Parking is convenient and free!!!!!!!
title: Music City Belvoir a Hit
comment: From the moment I checked in, I found the staff, accomodations, restaurants all outstanding.

everyoneShouldKnow: cleaniness
title: the hotel needs better management
comment: Very disappointed with the hotel.

everyoneShouldKnow: Great Staff,
title: Great Staff, a little dated creature comforts
comment: Treated wonderfully by the staff. Clifton was phenomenal.

everyoneShouldKnow: do not use their recommended taxi company universal
title: convenient to charlotte airport
comment: shuttle was slow to pick up at airport and you must be aware that it runs on the half-hour SHARP on the return back to airport .

title: Convenient and relaxing
comment: Great location (to downtown La Jolla or beach), quiet and peaceful. Room was nicely designed as was property. A great find.

everyoneShouldKnow: Good location, easy transportation using Amtrak and the "T".
title: Nice stay,nice location!
comment: Just got back from staying At the Sheaton Boston from 12/29 - 1/1/12. Had a club room suite which was very nice overlooking the Charles river.Only issue was that we were charged $12.95 per day for internet service which is susposed to be complimentary in the club rooms. Front desk person said she was going to take it off my bill(which hasn't happened). Also, it would be beneficial if there was some sort of humidifer system in the rooms. The forced hot air dries out your system. In the morning you feel as if you have a mouth/noseful of dried concrete.

everyoneShouldKnow: Beware of rude staff.
title: Great Location, Unprofessional Staff
comment: The location for this hotel cannot be beat for leisure and business travelers. Close to everything. The staff is not very professional and I was a bit surprised that they don't offer much recognition for being a Platinum member. I had to wait for my room for several hours even though I requested an early check in. I was not upgraded as the benefits suggest. I witnessed a cleaning lady tell off a manager in the club lounge in public. I was rudly stopped in the club lounge by the hostess who accused me of trying to sneak in more people without paying.

everyoneShouldKnow: Gold Lounge now in Play !
title: Great Property
comment: This place has really kicked it up a Notch ! They have spent money to make this is very Nice resort like property - Kuddos on adding the Gold Lounge --- we stay at this property alot as we have a Daughter in Tucson ......

everyoneShouldKnow: This location is difficult to reach if you are coming on I-10 headed east.
title: Disappointed
comment: Unfortunately, this hotel's service was below my expectations: We had 4 adults staying on the club level for 3 nights. The two days housekeeping cleaned the rooms, they only left towel sets for 2 people. On one particular evening, we called down for additional towels and never received them that evening. We had the continental breakfast service: Around 9am when we went to the continental breakfast area, the trash can was overflowing, there were not plates to place pastries on, there was no more coffee, milk or creamer. I was very disappointed in my stay and will not be returning any time soon.

everyoneShouldKnow: The beds are very comfortable.
title: NOT ALL STAFF IS HELPFUL
comment: The overall stay was good and I am a Happy Grandbourne member. Only issue is that I was not acknowledged at the time of check in as a Grandbourne member and it seemed to bother the employee that I requested my upgrade and confirmed my free internet. I did not feel welcomed at all. I also left an item in the room and when I called the hotel to notify them, I was advised that nothing could be done because the housekeeping manager was gone for the day and the hotel manager was too.

everyoneShouldKnow: The Club Level amenities
title: Love the Club Lounge
comment: We really loved staying on the Club Floor. This was our first time staying at the Belvoir Harborside. Vivien was great. Friendly & personable. Inky was our housekeeper. What a really nice girl. Eager to please.

title: Valet Parking
comment: Personnel were very attentive. Rooms were very nice and clean.

everyoneShouldKnow: Call aheard to make sure your room is ready!
title: New Years Eve
comment: The check in process was below standard. We arrived at 3:45 for a 4:00 check in. We were told our room wasn't ready yet and it would be around 20 minutes. It ended up being two hours later and that was after us having to check back repeatedly. Very young, poorly trained staff!

title: All was fine
comment: Had a great rate so wasn't expecting the world, but...the room was clean and comfortable. The staff was very friendly. Nothing really in the area, but has a decent sports bar with decent food. Would defiantly stay he again.

everyoneShouldKnow: Great club floor
title: Amazing Resort
comment: Definitely the place to stay while in Anaheim. Great location to Disneyland as well as to other restaurants in the area. One of the best Club Floor Lounge experiences I have had. The staff was always friendly and helpful while providing a phenomenal breakfast and afternoon snacks. Worth every penny to upgrade to a club floor suite!

title: Hotel was ok
comment: Stayed New Year's Eve. Arrived around 7 to be told valet was full and that I would have to park my own car. Our tv only got 6 channels and 4 of those were hotel channels. Told the lady at check out about it and it was "passed on"

everyoneShouldKnow: Exceptional service
title: Awesome package!
comment: This was not only our 1st time attending the NYE party, but also our 1st time staying @ a Belvoir property. I was a little nervous since we did not know anyone there or had not known of anyone that had been there b4, but the flyer for the party sounded like the best party and room package for NYE, and it definately was! We were so pleased with everything from the appearance of the hotel to how easy checking in and out was! The food was great, the front desk service was exceptional, and the room was as perfect as it looked on the flyer. We had the best time at the NYE party that we've ever had and we didn't know a soul there! Not only are we looking foward to doing it again next year, but while we were there we sat down with a hotel consultant and discussed possibly having our wedding reception there in 2013! We are your two newest biggest fans of the Mahwah Belvoir, thank you so much for ending 2011 and starting 2012 with as much joy and happiness as possible!

everyoneShouldKnow: Great Fitness Center/Pool
title: Great overall value
comment: I've stayed at this hotel more than 2 dozen times. There's always that 'welcome home' feeling when I arrive. The service is fantastic. The staff really cares about providing a memorable experience.

title: Ok but needs improvement
comment: Staff at the hotel were courteous, the size of the room is standard but the t&b is a bit tight. One major complaint is their aircon. Especially during the wee hours of the morning, we stayed their for 2 nights, both nights my wife and I woke up because the aircon is simply not enough to cool the room. Maybe that is the reason why they have a small fan in the closet. I have also seen a similar complaint from another site. Hopefully they would address that. The best feature for us is the proximity of the hotel to Universal studio. Also adding a ref to the room would definitely help since these stuff are standard anyways in any hotel.

everyoneShouldKnow: Great Location
title: Great New Year's Eve
comment: This was the second year in a row that we stayed here for New Year's Eve; we wanted to see the fireworks.

everyoneShouldKnow: If you are a light sleeper bring earplugs.
title: Nice stay
comment: The staff was very helpful and pleasant. I was concerned about noise in the airport area, but that was not an issue. Even in a suite however the next door rooms on both sides could be clearly heard in conversation. I wish they had real glassware, but they did bring us some to use instead of plastic when we asked. Minimal electric outlets were the only other issue. The room was a nice size and the view was pleasant, the furnishings were fine also. We found it a convenient drive to various parts of town.

everyoneShouldKnow: Avoid days the Saints Play
title: sugar bowl 2012
comment: Rooms were booked with a tour group for the Sugar Bowl.

everyoneShouldKnow: Service is above and beyond the call of duty
title: Excellent Service
comment: Excellent Club Level Service and staff are more than friendly with any potential issue or problem one may have.

everyoneShouldKnow: Walking distance to the airport terminals
title: Good location
comment: Especially for travelers who are transiting or need easy access to the airport. This is one of the better airport hotels I've stayed at.

everyoneShouldKnow: Staff is exceptional.
title: Exceptional service
comment: Every single staff member was exceptionally gracious and helpful. Front desk employee was thoughtful enough to give us a room with a spectacular view of downtown. Room was very clean and the bed very comfortable.Breakfast buffet was excellent. My kids loved the indoor pool. Overall our experience could not have been better.

title: Great Stay
comment: The rooms/suites are great and the staff was wonderful.

everyoneShouldKnow: Don't expect to be treated like a human being.
title: Terrible customer service
comment: I attempted to order room service at this hotel and had one of the worst customer service experiences I have ever encountered. We were told room service would take around an hour to arrive. One hour later we call back to check the status of the order and are told they don't send orders up to the rooms until they have 8 orders to take and it should just be a few more minutes. Twenty minutes later I call back and I am told that it is on the elevator right now. Twenty minutes later I walk down to the lobby to find out what the hold up is. The front desk calls room service to inquire and the person on the phone HANGS UP on the front desk clerk. She is embarassed and I ask her if she just got hung up on by another employee and she embarassingly agrees. She apologizes profusely for the room service clerks terrible behavior, but it's too late at this point. If they treat their coworkers like this don't expect you to get anything better. Needless to say the room service was cancelled. The room itself was sub par. The end table was broken on one corner. The bathroom had visible stains in the tub.

everyoneShouldKnow: Enjoyable
title: Thanks
comment: Finally, a nice hotel that's really pet friendly. I was traveling with a Golden Retriever, that is a member of the family, and we all were treated in a friendly, attentive and professional manner. As a "snow bird" I will be sure to make Belvoir Jacksonville my twice a year stop.

everyoneShouldKnow: Very pet friendly
title: Excellent Location, very pet friendly
comment: The location was excellent, the suites are spacious. We are traveling with our German Shepherd and found the staff very welcoming. They even provided gloves and scooper bags (although looking at the front lawn, not many people used them).

title: Awesome stay
comment: The staff and facilities were exceptional. Had a great time with friends and family.

everyoneShouldKnow: Out of the way.
title: Downtown
comment: Hotel in area that is desolate at night and while it may be safe appears to leave a caual walker at risk. Front desk does not know promotion codes for BPG guests and checkin required 1/2 hour and two people to adjust room rate to promotion code on reservation. At checkout another 1/2 hr was required to again adjust rate with different people. Halls and lobby of hotel are darkly lit giving impression of being in an old outdated hotel (which it is not). Room size is okay but bathrooms are small. Parking very expensive especially since accross the street paking is 1/4 the rate. Wireless cost money for BPG guests which seems to be a Grandbournes policy but is an irratent and makes one wnat to choose other hotels where it's free.

everyoneShouldKnow: The rooms are pretty worn ut will hopefully shine in a new light after the currently ongoing renovation!
title: Urgently needs renovation (which is currently ongoing as I understand)
comment: I stayed here countless times for business and to be honest only when other BPG properties nearby were booked. The Belvoir Parsippany is not only worn and urgently needs a renovation but also the equipment of rooms and the friendliness of the staff is not really what you expect from a BPG property (last time there wasn't any internet access available - not even wired). It's by far the worst BPG property I have been and I do strongly hope that after the current renovation not only the the rooms and equipment but also the general atmosphere will improve.

everyoneShouldKnow: This is a great gem of an option when trying to stay in NYC
title: Great Way to Start the Year!
comment: Stayed here over the New Year Weekend

everyoneShouldKnow: On the far side of downtown, but completely worth the walk.
title: Excellent Service!
comment: The staff here could show the staffs at other BPG properties a thing or two. They go out of their way to make you feel welcome; they are extremely helpful with information, maps and recommendations.

everyoneShouldKnow: Great Rooms and Views of Chicago and Navy Pier.
title: A Great Stay!
comment: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Belvoir for the New Years weekend. The staff was wonderful and very accommodating for whatever our needs were. We will definitely go back there!

title: A great New Years Eve!
comment: we have attended many New Years Eve parties at hotels and catering halls, and I have to say that this party was the best. From the cocktail party to the next day brunch, there was an abundance of food. A great selection and the service was excellent. The band was very good and we had a blast.

everyoneShouldKnow: The staff is excellent
title: Great
comment: Everything was terrific, except a minor problem with the hot water.

everyoneShouldKnow: Not your ordinary hotel pool - fun and room for all
title: Keep Coming Back
comment: We have spent the last three years celebrating the holidays at this hotel with family. The front end staff (and manager) have made every effort to make sure that our requests are met. It is the staff at this hotel as well as the location that keeps us coming back. We are given a warm welcome and great service in the restaurants and by the pool. Special requests are remembered from the year before - peanut butter and honey, who drinks tea/coffee - the same staff have been there all three years. We have met a special lady who cleans our rooms 5 out of the 7 days during the two week period and she made a point of learning our names - our rooms are always very clean when she is on duty. Some of us like to take the tram into Kona and back while the golfers like the idea of having a golf course that they love to play close to the hotel. The pool is where we spend a lot of our time with lots of space to spread out.

title: Fasilities close too early
comment: Arrived at 1100 pm, bell staff told us we could order room service 24 hours, which was untrue, unable to after 1100,. All restaurants closed also, had to get the car from valet and go driving somewhere in an unknown city gor some food. Also literature in room misleading and staff states they had just changed their times , was very frustrating after long trip

everyoneShouldKnow: If you're looking for a relaxing stay...choose this hotel...if you are looking for a spring break, party til you puke resort, do us all a favor and go elsewhere.
title: New Year's Stay 2011/2012
comment: We had a wonderful stay and I was pleasantly surprised given some negative comments previously posted. The location was great...on a quiet beach but only minutes from restaurants and shopping. We found the beach beautiful and relaxing, the pool, while small for a hotel this size, was more than adequate and equally relaxing. Service at the poolside bar and restaurant was friendly and prompt, as was the service at the bar and restaurtant in the hotel. The staff was friendly and helpful and we plan to book at this hitel when we return to the area.

everyoneShouldKnow: Its not a four star hotel
title: Ok for a College Students
comment: Room small

everyoneShouldKnow: Great location
title: Nice but not at Grandbourne caliber
comment: No free Wi-Fi. Poor quality toilet tissue. Furniture seems due for upgrade.

everyoneShouldKnow: Private entrance to Lego Land
title: Great for Legoland
comment: I stayed here with our 2 grandchildren 4 and 8. It was great that the pool was open 24 hours. The kids wanted to swim at 6:30 am and it was no problem. The private entrance to Lego land is also a bonus for the us and the kids. There was plenty to keep them happy, the staff was more than helpful in meeting the kids needs, giving them special cups for juice, coloring books etc. I would recommend this place for families.

everyoneShouldKnow: Great Views and Great Times!
title: Loved this hotel
comment: We stayed December 2011 into the new year and this was a great hotel and location. Our room came with free parking and water taxi rides which were great!

everyoneShouldKnow: Very contemporary feel. Located close to interstate exit and great bed.
title: Safe Haven
comment: Got caught due to bad weather. Use BPG points for stay and even though the hotel system and BPG were working to show my reservation, staff handled it quickly and got us into our room.

everyoneShouldKnow: Great service
title: gteat hotel
comment: We recently stayed at this hotel during a very busy time. I had stayed here in 2005 and was very excited to be doing so again. The remodel is great!! I had a problem with my climate control and thought it was due to weather changing. After waiting several hours I went to front desk and they told me they would have someone look at it. I was expecting someone within 30 minutes or so but much to my sunrise the maintance person was on the elevator with me!!! It took him two seconds and I was very comfortable. Great service.........go dawgs

everyoneShouldKnow: Great Staff. You will feel pampered.
title: One of my Top Hotel Experiences
comment: Thank You BPG and Belvoir. I am very impressed when I receive incredible treatment from the BPG level and find consistency with the same treatment down through each level of staff at one of the hotels. My BPG started with great help to switch a last minute reward reservation in a timely manner. Although a great hotel and location, your staff made this trip a great trip and we received incredible treatment from each and every person that we interacted with. Michelle at the front desk was our initial person that we met with and should be given extra special congratulations for establishing our initial impression of your hotel. She was excellent at her job and remembered us when we left. Your happy hour staff was so great during a crazy new year's timeframe. I complement their attitude and treatment amidst juggling a lot of requests. We will be back to visit again!!!

everyoneShouldKnow: In room TV's are very poor in quality. Like watching with sun glasses on.
title: Internet Speed
comment: Internet speed is extremely poor. System is no better than phone dialup. System is old and needs to be upgrade ASAP.

everyoneShouldKnow: I enjoyed my view of Sandia Peak.
title: Always a great stay with a lot of personal service.
comment: Staying at the Belvoir Uptown is the highlight of my NM sales week.

everyoneShouldKnow: 44th floor club lounge is great.
title: Good Hotel as long as nothing bad happens
comment: We have been here many times and enjoyed the hotel very much. The view from the 44th floor lounge is great.

everyoneShouldKnow: Friendly staff, excellent location and beautiful rooms.
title: New Years Eve Stay
comment: We had a large group book a block of rooms for New Years eve. The check in process was quick and friendly. The room was extremely neat. We loved being downtown near the ped mall and the kids had a great time in the pool. Excellent stay, I am planning to do the whole thing again next year!

everyoneShouldKnow: Don't book this hotel until it's been renovated or re-branded. It's not typical Grandbourne quality at all.
title: Not happy at all!!!!!!
comment: I'm highly disappointed in this hotel. I read several reviews of this hotel that were quite positive. However, I struggled to find anything positive about this hotel. The hotel was full of unrulely kids and the hotel security did nothing about them until about midnight. Also, the room wasn't clean at all. I felt dirty the entire time I was there. Futhermore, when I got home I found my suitcase filled with ants. The thing I'm most upset about is that I used my Grandbourne Preferred Guest points to book this stay. I won't ever get those points back either. What a waste.

everyoneShouldKnow: Unfriendly and unwelcoming staff
title: Unfriendly staff and dirty windows
comment: I was sincerely dissappointed with our one night stay at thie Belvoir Hotel.

title: Dallas Trip
comment: Staff was very helpful especially Tamara. Location was good and the breakfast buffet was outstanding! Biggest disappointment was the cleanliness of the pool.

everyoneShouldKnow: the Christmas trees were outstanding!
title: outstanding
comment: from the time you get out of your car to the time you close the door to leave - you are treated with smiles, good mornings and you truly feel special.

everyoneShouldKnow: Be careful of being over charged
title: Poor treatment of guest by Ben the accounting manager
comment: Had some concerns about charges that needed to be reversed and Ben the acct/ business manager approached me just after having smoke break with is nasty smell on him to address my concern apporced me like I was a thug from the streets. He was totally unprofessional and after doing business for over 4 years I will no longer stay or place my guest at this hotel. The Guest service front desk laies are more professional than this Ben person who should be trained in the area of customer service and to gains so better interpersonal skills.

everyoneShouldKnow: It is on the beach and the staff is great.
title: Great staff and location
comment: The staff was excellent. They were friendly and helpful. The responded quickly to any needs we had. There was construction going on during our stay that closed the pool and fitness center, but that was not really an issue since we were interested in the beach and other activities in VA beach. So, the construction was not at all an issue. The hotel is well maintained and our room was clean.

everyoneShouldKnow: Gorgeous facilities; car salesman-like staff intent on getting you into a timeshare.
title: The focus is on the timeshare business.
comment: As a hotel guest, one expects to be treated well, but at the Belvoir Vistana Resort, it feels like the resort's focus on the timeshare ownership business is at the expense of hotel guests' comfort. For example, I received almost twice daily messages in my room reminding me to attend information sessions on available timeshare opportunities, was greeted with a "welcome gift bag" (which was really just awful coffee and an opportunity to be accosted by a salesman trying to rope us into attending an information session), and finally, while I booked a "bed and breakfast" rate online, was never informed on how I could go about finding the breakfast.

title: 3 NIGHTS IN CLUB ROOM
comment: NICE LOUNGE AND SPACIOUS ROOM. BUT INTERNET SPEED IS HORRIBLE.

title: Disappointed
comment: I and and have been a BPG Platinum member. I had two rooms for 5 days each. I was not upgraded in either room. I had to request bath robes and one they gave had a hole in it. Not what I would expect from this hotel. Went to the bar one evening, and that was a disaster. Poor choices, not very clean & the service was almost non-existent.

everyoneShouldKnow: Close to the Riverwalk
title: Great Historic Hotel!
comment: Beautiful historic hotel with a great location. Close to the Riverwalk and the Majestic Theater. Service was excellent and staff friendly.Loved it and will be back again!

everyoneShouldKnow: The courtesy of the staff is very dependent on the person and the moment
title: Repeated Problems and Extreme Disappointment
comment: This was the worst experience I've ever had with Grandbourne. Over my Monday - Thursday stay, our problems included:

everyoneShouldKnow: Location was fabulous. Catered to all our needs and provided a wonderful home base for all our activities. Very welcoming.
title: Features
comment: The hotel has great features and facilities. As a family it provided everything that was needed to entertain both our teenagers and us adults. From the pool areas to the bar(s) and the casual dining.

title: Better than last time
comment: Just stayed for one night. Staff on check-in was friendlier than I have experienced in the past. They recognized my Platinum status and asked me what amenity I wanted.

everyoneShouldKnow: Great pool area with bar and food service and adequate loungers and quiet spaces.
title: Excellent location and view
comment: Stayed here Christmas Day. Enjoyed all the warm hospitality and the service was excellent for the holiday period - as the hotel was very busy. We were boarding a cruise ship after a late check-out and we viewed the ship from our room. The desk staff was very helpful.

title: Beware, Tricks & Traps!
comment: The hotel is nice and the staff members were polite, yet I have to fight for internet as offered free with booking, but always charged additional when check-out.

everyoneShouldKnow: THEY [OVER]CHARGE FOR PARKING WHICH THEY DO NOT TELL YOU ABOUT
title: Disappointed - PLEASE READ!
comment: At first glance while booking my reservation, I was very pleased because it was, though expensive, a pretty decent price for holiday dates and letting me get a AAA discount. I was very happy and excited to learn of the free shuttle to and from Disneyland. I am an annual passholder and tried this out to see if this hotel would be nice to stay at multiple times when convenient.

title: Roll the Dice
comment: Great proximity to outlet shopping and the best place to stay if attending a conference in AC. Hop in a cab for a (very) short ride to the hot casino hotels and nightlife...this hotel is in the center of everything.

everyoneShouldKnow: Top Pick in area
title: Great Service
comment: This is my favorite hotel in the area because they consistently deliver not good but great service. Keep it up!

everyoneShouldKnow: it is PERFECTLY positioned for EVERYTHING!!! only 5 mins walk to everywhere!! and SPOTLESSLy CLEAN!!
title: fantastic choice of hotel
comment: i stayed in this hotel at the end of november 2011 for 5 nights, it is absol;utely excellent the position is so close to everything 3-5 mins walk fromm central park, rockerfellar centre, times square 5th ave etc etc it is spotlessly clesn and the staff were very accomodating (although we didnt really need to ask them much)!! it is a safe area in the evenings especially for a group of females!11 definately would stay there again its PERFECT!! and well priced too

title: Nice Room
comment: I thought the room was very nice, the staff was courteous. I didn't like the location of the room on a lower level because of a lot of morning noise with garbage trucks and other delivery vehicles making quite a bit of noise.

everyoneShouldKnow: Great Service
title: GREAT STAY
comment: Fantastic hotel, just renovated and looks beautiful. I travel 75 nights a year for business and this is one of my favorite hotels to stay. The staff treat you with respect and make you feel very comfortable. If you are coming to NYC on business or pleasure this is the hotel to stay.

everyoneShouldKnow: Great Staff! CLEAN Comfortable Rooms. Safe environment.
title: Easy Stay
comment: The key to a great hotel is a Great Staff and this facility has that kind of staff. Every team member makes you feel as if you are family from the time you walk in. The spirit of this staff is "CAN DO" . I am on my 5th stay at this facility and I can assure you the staff is always the same. I think you would call them genuine. I actually look forward to my stays here. The fact that the location has easy access is a plus.

everyoneShouldKnow: Really nice rooms and great service
title: Excellent experience
comment: The staff was excellent, room was great, breakfast was really enjoyable. When we arrived, the young lady at the front desk greeted us warmly and within less than a minute had us checked in with keys in hand. Best front desk service ever! The waitress at breakfast was sweet, helpful, and attentive. Everyone was polite and welcoming. Great place to stay! Would definitely recommend.

title: Great staff
comment: Staff has been great so far. They recognize you if you are a regular.

title: maintenance
comment: once again i had a negative experience at this hotel...had to move rooms after the second day as their was a maintenance issue that closed main tower..seems there is always a problem here....

everyoneShouldKnow: Nice location and view of Airport
title: Enjoyed Belvoir Gateway Atlanta Airport
comment: This is a great hotel and I plan on returning. Appreciated the AAA - Automobile Club discount! Did not appreciate the rules concerning "Make a Green Choice" - as I did not use any janitorial or linen changes for the full 3 nights - yet was only able to 'earn' for 2 of the nights. If I had known this, I may have not even attempted to use the program. This was a disappointment - allow a guest to earn as they stay (not within your rules) - and why I rated the 'facilities' portion as only 'good.'

everyoneShouldKnow: Stay away
title: Horrible Stay
comment: Right from the check in procedure this hotel has many issues .Confirmed and paid for an ocean view king room , tried to give is a double , 30 minuted of wait they gave us a king room overlooking garage by frieght elevater. 45 more minutes to resolve, room was worst room i have stayed , worse that most small town motels i have stayed in , paper thin walls,one picture in the " decorated " rooms. A 5 x 5 cut out in drywall on ceiling very poorly patched and painted. rudest bartenders and serving staff i have seen in mamy years. Hotel wing to be demolished next year from what i understand _ two years to late for this dump

everyoneShouldKnow: Great location, great club floor
title: NIce hotel, but the rooms heater was broken when we arrived
comment: this will be a mixed review:

everyoneShouldKnow: Inconsiderate & inattentive staff.
title: Poor service & constant knocking on doors
comment: I am a Grandbourne Gold member. We Stayed at the Belvoir Miami Airport hotel on 1/5/12. I placed a wakeup call for 5:00.A.M. & 5:05 A.M. The call was never received & we would have missed our 7:00 A.M. flight if my wife had not awakened. In addition, there was constant knocking on various doors throught the night. Either food being delivered or luggage being delivered. Most inconsiderate.

everyoneShouldKnow: Convenient for airport, but charges for parking.
title: Just OK
comment: Managed to have enough disappointments in a one-night stay here: paying for parking at an airport hotel seems a bitter pill to swallow. Room was ok, didn't seem like a Platinum upgrade at all. Still, was quite comfortable and a good bad. A number of facilities were unavailable, like the Club Lounge, so a very basic breakfast buffet was offered (we're talking some pop tarts, filter coffee and bagels). Gym was also closed, so not much left in terms of facilities. The tiny pool could be appealing to kids, but anyone else would want to stay as little time as possible at this property, which is exactly what I did.

title: Post New years eve stay
comment: I stayed here with my two boys ahead of a trip to Breckenridge, nice hotel but really disappointed that the room constantly smelled like smoke, we complained about this 3 times and eventually someone came up and sprayed the carpet. We are due to return today for 3 nights and am really hoping it wont be the same...shame as the facilities and location are great

everyoneShouldKnow: It's not clean!
title: Terrible Stay
comment: My stay here was terrible. I arrived after dark and had to park in an unlit, unstaffed parking lot which felt very unsafe. The hotel room was lit only by glaring flourescent lights, even on the bedside, giving an institutional feel. The room was not clean, with visible dirt & grime. I ordered a salad from room service for dinner, and it had wilted and rotten lettuce, and was truly inedible.

title: Great location
comment: I've stayed in tis Hotel several times a few years ago and have always loved the location. With the new renovation the Hotel have gained another star in My book. Lovely bedcomfort!

everyoneShouldKnow: Know what you're getting when you make the reservation.
title: Not great for this BPG Gold member
comment: When I made this reservation I specifically asked if we would have access to the BPG Club Lounge. The BPG rep. called the hotel and we were told yes. Upon checkin the front desk person was pretty rude and informed us that no we didn't have access. To her we were asking for the world. I didn't want to fuss about it in front of the other people in our party. Before checkout, I asked again what were the rules to access the lounge, and was told that we should have had access the entire time. I understand that mistakes happen, but it was too little too late.

everyoneShouldKnow: This hotel is not that great
title: This hotel is not up to par
comment: This hotel served the purpose of giving me a place to stay, but that's about it. Maybe a step above the cheap motels, but not by much.

everyoneShouldKnow: Despite a few amenities being remodeled for the better part of a year, it was the hotel staff that madeall the difference.
title: Staff Made the Difference
comment: It's not often a person has the opportunity to get to know a hotel and its staff as well as I. Work afforded me the opportunity to visit Philadelphia for the better part of last year (nearly every week). I must say the Belvoir's staff seemed more like family than service providers by the end of the year. Having grown up in the South, I have come accustomed to expect genuine hospitality. Furthermore, I was not expecting to find this treatment among the hustle of Center City-Philadelphia. Quite the contrary, the Belvoir management and staff made the difference in my hotel choice all year. From weekly greetings by Patrick to helped with my luggage, to checking-in with Candace and Andrew at the front desk, I was made to feel welcome. Top it off with exceptional service in the lobby bar & restaurant all year by Nicole, Peter, Greg, Daniele, and Amanda. Breakfast with Nick or a coffee and danish with Marilyn, they each made me feel at home while away from home from the start. Thanks for taking such good care of me! I look forward to visiting again.

everyoneShouldKnow: Terrible, terrible, terrible customer service
title: HORRIBLE experience!!!!!!!!!!!
comment: Hotel staff had no customer service capabilities!!! My wife and I "reserved" a refiridgerator due to a medical need. None were available at check-in, first come first serve regardless of reservation or medical need!!! It took 36 hours to get one!!! Staff failed to mention that a pile driver would be working outside of our ocean view room at 7 AM. We were left with no towels in the bathroon...it took 1/2 a day to get towels delivered to our room. No one on staff really cared.

everyoneShouldKnow: Do not stay here unless you are a flight crew and need to be close to the airport.
title: 2 out of 3 elevators broke
comment: The hotel is conveniently close to Port Everglades and the airport but there is no good reason to stay here. There is nothing around the property to do other than go straight to the airport or the cruise ship. 2 out of 3 elevators were broken which made the stay even more difficult. The carpets and rooms need upgrading. The beds were fine. The only concession. Very disappointed.

everyoneShouldKnow: This hotel went out of its way to make me feel very comfortable, and finally made me understand why I am a Grandbourne member. This hotel treated me like a VIP, and gave me great service all around.
title: Grandbourne Members
comment: This hotel went out of its way to make me feel very comfortable, and finally made me understand why I am a Grandbourne member. This hotel treated me like a VIP, and gave me great service all around.

everyoneShouldKnow: The staff is super friendly and helpful!
title: VIP Treatment
comment: I have traveled all over US and stayed in many Grandbourne hotels. This hotel is beyond fantastic. Because of my status and Grandbourne Member, I was contacted by the front desk before my arrival, to see if I needed anything......they helped me out with early check in, got a room next to my friends etc. The Concierge, Front desk, management and the lobby bar were all always so happy, friendly and helpful. I would go back and stay here every time I am in the area! MUST STAY

everyoneShouldKnow: The bathroom door makes getting out of the shower very difficult.

everyoneShouldKnow: If you need a late check out, call after 7:00 or 7:30 am over night person can not help or assist you. I did request a late check out and around 7am I was declined to me. I guess the staff should be empower to make a decision like a late check out specially if the guest is a loyal member.
title: Recognicion

everyoneShouldKnow: Good location
title: Perfect location met our needs
comment: Everything about the hotel met our needs. The reason we chose it was because our family had already booked their room reservations there. The only thing I was disappointed in was their lack of matching their competitors rates. I had never been to Tampa before and a big competitor was offering the room for less and everytime I called the Belvoir they would not budge on the price. Little did I know the Hyatt was around the corner. I had even asked the reservation agent (the first time I call) how far the hotel was and they didn't know. The hotel was not busy

title: No communication
comment: Earlier in the day on 1/7, I called the Belvoir to ask that my wife be put on the reservation so that she could check in at 3pm before I arrived. I was told that this was all set and a note was in the system letting the front desk know of this. When my wife arrived, she was told there was no record of me calling and that she would have to wait until I arrived to check into the hotel. This really interrupted our plans as she needed to use the room to change for the outdoor hockey games at Fenway that night. When I called back later, I was told by the Customer Service person that I needed to contact the hotel directly and that the toll free number (which was in fact the Belvoir Boston) I called was a general Customer Service number. At this point, I was able to make the addition to the reservation, but it took 3 call attempts and A LOT of time to do it.

everyoneShouldKnow: Service and facilties no longer meet prior high standards.
title: Not up to usual standards
comment: We have stayed at the Dolphin on multiple occasions and find that it offers great value and is ideally located with excellent transportation access to the parks. Unfortunately, our latest experience was a real disappointment. The rooms were not in good repair; mine had a non-working telephone, and mini-refrigerator that didn't work other than to buzz loudly at times making sleep impossible, and a bathtub that didn't drain. We eventually got these problems fixed but we shouldn't have experienced them in the first place. The wireless internet service didn't work, although multiple calls including lengthy hold times resulted in another service we could utilize by the last day of our 5 day stay. We also never received maid service one day despite being in the parks until after 7 p.m. Overall the experience was disppointing, so I will be looking for another hotel for future WDW stays.

everyoneShouldKnow: Completely different hotel since the renovation; great staff; nice hotel for being located in the airport premises
title: Great job on the renovation!
comment: I've stayed at this hotel several times now - both before and after renovation, and I can't complement the hotel enough on the improvements! If you stayed here previously, you'll know that there was no where to go but up and they did just that. For an airport hotel they did a great job of making you feel comfortable - if anything, I don't really feel like I'm staying in the middle of the airport when I'm there (aside from the fact that the rooms look at runways). I also have to complement that bar/restaurant on having one of the better craft beer selections I've seen in a hotel. The staff is great too - always very friendly and they do their best to accommodate needs. The Grandbourne options are limited in Cleveland but they did a great job with the one they have.

title: Am excellent Belvoir
comment: I stayed here once during renovations a few years ago, and thought I'd never come back, it was really a lousy experience. But I happened to be in town again recently, and was really wowed. Looks like a brand-new hotel downstairs, and the lobby was just being decorated for Christmas with the tree and gingerbread houses, it was really pretty.

everyoneShouldKnow: Great location to NYC. Warm and friendly atmosphere!

title: Odd First Experience, but will return.

About an hour later I heard my door open up, and had a couple walk into the room quite surprised to find me there. Apparently the front desk gave them the room after already giving it to me, so I called to inform them. I got the expected apologies, but nobody seemed to put two and two together that my room keys would no longer work. It occurred to me that might be the case, so I checked myself a little while later and sure enough they were inactive. I went down to the lobby to handle that problem, and the gentleman who checked me in was a bit short with me but still apologetic. I got some story about the system crashing, but he then proceeded to quickly reactivate my keys so who knows if that was true or not.

everyoneShouldKnow: Great location, Great service!

everyoneShouldKnow: Great Atmosphere
title: Great Service and Experience
comment: I have used the Portsmouth Harborside for business travel and meeting activities three times in 2011 and have not been disappointed. The staff is attentive to needs; whether personal or group related and the food is excellent! The location is great as it is just off of I-95 with ample parking, but not in the middle of downtown so there is a quietness when in the hotel. The sales and catering groups make business events easy and the rooms and setups can fit any need. Working with the sales manager to plan and hold events has been a pleasure and he makes sure nothing has been forgotten. During my last visit in December I encountered two individuals that are prime examples of the high level of service this hotel provides. The woman attending to guests needs on the Club Level greets everyone with a smile. I had questions about Portsmouth and she was more than willing to take some time to discuss the local area. The other employee was assigned to our group (27 people) for a formal luncheon. she asked questions before the attendees arrived about timing of the luncheon (presentations, speeches, awards ceremony, etc) to time her movements in the room so not to be a distraction. She was attentive to the needs of the group and made sure the presentation of dinner and dessert tables was perfect and maintained throughout the event. These were just two examples of a great customer service that stuck out amongst others at the desk, sales and restaurant that make visiting the Portsmouth Harborside a pleasant experience!

everyoneShouldKnow: Pay a little extra and get a room upgrade.

comment: Enjoyed my 2 night stay. Was upgraded to a very nice suite for only $20 per night. Parking is hard to find so I was forced to use valet. Enjoyed the pool and the restaurant. I would highly recommend this hotel.

everyoneShouldKnow: You will not find better staff anywhere!

comment: From the valet parking staff to the front desk, housekeeping, concierge level and bartending staff, couldn't ask for more professional, expert service. Great recommendations for places to eat, visit in San Antonio. Location is perfect to visit any part of the city. I love historic hotels, this is one of the best.

everyoneShouldKnow: Good location, great view, clean, def recommend!
title: Great hotel in prime location
comment: I stayed here for the BCS championship game, when NOLA was totally crazy. I stayed in the club level, and was able to check in to my room as soon as I arrived @ 10 AM, which was a nice surprise. Room was clean, bed was comfy. Bonus for club level is the breakfast... not hot but quality pastries, fresh fruit, hard boiled eggs and such. It never took too long for the elevators despite the heavy traffic. Did I mention the amazing location??!! I would definitely stay here again.

everyoneShouldKnow: Consistently friendly and attentive staff.
title: Work Traveler
comment: The hotel is great for work travel. The exception being the breakfast service in the restaurant. In need of an overhaul. I've eaten breakfast 3 times at this hotel recently while traveling for work, and the morning service just doesn't cut it. Not organized and inconsistent. All other facilities, including the workout center score high, as does the staff.

title: Staff unprepared for big weekend
comment: My wife and I stayed here during the BCS National Championship weekend. The hotel was at full capacity and did not have the staff to meet the guests' needs. The hotel itself is a nice alternative to downtown New Orleans. It is close to the airport and a short drive to downtown. The rooms are nice, clean, and comfortable. The food from the restaurant was great. The workout room is acceptable. Our service was very poor in comparison to other Belvoirs that I have visited. There were no bellmen availible to help us with our luggage. I ordered roomservice for breakfast. I called back after the order was delivered to ask for a spoon and was told, "We do not have time to bring you just a spoon. We will bring it when we can." The next morning I ordered a bagel and the woman taking the order asked me to come pick it up at the restaurant instead of delivering it to my room. In my opnion, a hotel with the reputation and comitment to quality like Belvoir should have known that they would be at full capacity and made better preperations for the weekend.

everyoneShouldKnow: Status means nothing...but rooms on the club level were nice.

Yes, it's annoying to work hard to obtain the highest status and have it mean nothing..."Huh..? upgrade? Amenity what?" yeah...come on BPG hotels, we DO expect better. Train staff to recognize your own rewards program!

everyoneShouldKnow: comfortable

comment: My husband and I choose to have a date night and out of all the hotels very happy to say we picked your place. Wonderful room guest accommodation dinner and quite time that was over due.

title: Very convenient and comfortable

Staff was attentive and very polite. Would stay here again. Very convenient. Close to all. Plus, you can't look out at the ocean at night with an ocean view room...

everyoneShouldKnow: This is not a "guest friendly" property.
