I have bought sheets from Target that were more comfortable than these. It felt as though I was sleeping in a plastic bag. The hotel staff were robotically pleasant... and parking... well, at 1am, when I tried to go out to grab a bite, I was told by the parking attendant that I either needed to go back to the front desk to register for parking or pay a 15 dollar exit fee, and then repay the 15 fee again when I returned. What a pain to deal with at that hour of the morning. I would never recomend this property to anyone... nor will I ever stay at this Belvoir again!

everyoneShouldKnow: Great location to call "home base" if you want to explore the entire island and all it has to offer!
title: Paradise in Poipu!
comment: I visited the beautiful island of Kauai for my 30th birthday and was conflicted about where to stay: The North end of the island in the fabled land of Hanalei? Or The South side of the island in close proximity to the airport and available for a lot less redemption points? Well, I decided on the latter and I'm so glad I did!

comment: Arriiived for checkin at noon. The clerk said that there were no roomss clean so we couldn't check in. I had booked a balcony and he assured me there would be no problem if I waited until after my meeting to check in.

everyoneShouldKnow: An average hotel with spotty customer service.
title: Good but could be much better
comment: I've stayed at this hotel multiple times over the past few months (business traveler). Although the lobby and public spaces have been recently renovated, the rooms are tired, worn and not cleaned well. During every stay I find it necessary to call Housekeeping or Maintenance to correct an issue with the room. During my last stay, I noticed the bed skirt was stained all along one side and what looked like a bag of mini pretzels that had been dumped (by a previous guest) in the corner of the room. Now I understand that "things happed", but what really annoyed me was the way the Housekeeping Manager addressed the problem. After changing the bed linens and re-vacuuming the room, no one said "I'm Sorry". In fact, I felt like they were annoyed to have to re-clean the room. Their attitude really turned me off. If there was another Grandbourne property anywhere else I would not stay at this hotel again. Alas there is not so I'm stuck with these people when visiting Harrisbug

everyoneShouldKnow: Great Food, Great Service, Great Venue
title: Best Wedding Venue in Columbus!
comment: We hosted a New Year's Eve 2011/2012 wedding for our daughter Jessica & son-in-law Nick, here! it was simply fantastic! The staff was friendly, the service and food was tremedous. Executive Chef Jonathan and Chef Jason prepared a spectacular meal for our 320 guests. The meals were delivered on time, the food was delicious and served hot! The service led by Vernon & staff was tremendous. Our guests raved about the venue, the food, the rooms, the staff, the lighting, the food, bar & restaurant service....all great. Our biggest treat was working with Chris & David., Catering & Banquet leads and the entire Belvoir 'A' Team! Belvoir: You made this Father of the Bride very happy & proud...Welcome to Columbus, Belvoir...and Happy New Year!

everyoneShouldKnow: The staff, and food are wonderful! The only negative point, is that in the fall (both time that we were there) the surf is very strong, and not ideal for swimming. Go to another part of the island for swimming.

comment: This hotel is first Belvoir hotel I have stayed at that did not meet my expectations. First off, it is very expensive with rooms priced around $200 per night. title: Hotel was clean and had freindly staff

everyoneShouldKnow: Location is good
title: Overall okay
comment: I have stayed at the hotel many times. This is the first time I have used the club and I would say to anyone it is definitely not worth the extra money. Breakfast and appetizers are aweful. You would do better to go out and buy them. The views of the river were very good and that I appreciated. The maid service was just okay if you like not having any coffee for the morning. Checkin was good , checkout was aweful. If you are in the gold line you will wait longer than anyone else. Also they were unable to assist with a simple lost and found item.

title: The Staff makes the difference
comment: I'm a Grandbourne Platinum member and have been for a while. I mention that only for perspective in that I stay at a LOT of different startwood facilities.

everyoneShouldKnow: Has a great view. Nice decor.
title: Love this hotel
comment: I have always loved staying at this hotel. I use it frequently.

everyoneShouldKnow: The hotel is clean and ok, but not your typical BPG hotel.
title: Comments on this hotel
comment: They offer no house coffee. If you want coffee early you have to drive to McDonald's. I get up to work out at 5:00 AM and (normally) most hotels have coffee in the lobby. Not here! I was told to wait until 6:30 AM or drive to McDonald's (which I did). Also I upgraded to a delux room for 1,000 additional points which was supposed to included a free breakfast. That did not happen. I was forced tp pay for breakfast.

everyoneShouldKnow: It has everything you need.
title: Perfect for Us
comment: This is our second time staying at the Boston Belvoir. My daughter is an prospective undergrad applying to one of the local colleges. The Boston Belvoir provided a comfortable and secure 'home' during a stressful time. The staff is friendly and the rooms are clean and inviting. During the cold months, the attached mall was a great way to take of some shopping without having to venture out into the 20 degree weather. We will surely stay here again.

everyoneShouldKnow: Affordable, but we got what we paid for.
title: Affordable But Disappointing
comment: We were pleased with the price but disappointed with the facility. Location is a good alternative to expensive downtown area, and parking is free. However, our room was old and outdated. The A/C panel fell to the floor as soon as we moved the floor lamp (which was apparently holding it up). One bed was missing a blanket, and there were no extra linens in the room. Only 2 sets of towels were in a room with 2 double beds. Multiple light bulbs were not working. Staff was responsive, but making numerous calls for assistance was very frustrating. Upon check out, 2 unauthorized charges were on room bill, and front desk attendent was rude in dealing with it.

everyoneShouldKnow: Stay away if you want to sleep comfortably.
title: Room temperature not well controlled
comment: When we arrived the attendant at the front desk looked down and walked away. No smile, no greeting, she did not want to be bothered. A short time later another greeted and told us to move away from the BPG Guest Check-in desk to another desk. She never said hello and never recognized us as Gold BPG Members.

everyoneShouldKnow: Shrimp Quesadilas and Jalapenos Bomber by the pool at fantastic
title: Always a Great Choice
comment: This is the second time I stayed there and came back because of my experience there before. I look to make this an annual vacation to this hotel.

title: Never Disappointment
comment: I've been staying at this hotel for years. I've never had a problem with the room cleanliness (up until this last recent stay and the worst thing was a Bud Light Bottle Cap between the cushion of the chair). The staff has always been courteous and helpful. I love that it's so close to the outlets and adjacent to the Tun Tavern. In the past we've been next to very rowdy guests and we've had our room changed with no problems.

everyoneShouldKnow: older hotel
title: older hotel....
comment: This hotel is an "older" Belvoir with small rooms and bathrooms. The hotel is located near the San Diego airport which is convenient however when you open the sliding glass doors you are overcome by jet fuel odors and noise! The walls are "thin" and I was able to hear noise from the rooms nearby. Did not get an upgrade with my Platinum status ... had to ask for the amenities and no upgraded room. The Club Lounge was nice. The location is great for the airport but you must take a taxi to do anything else in the area... nothing nearby (stores, shopping, tourist attractions, etc.).

everyoneShouldKnow: It's a franchise
title: Don't laugh at me when I have a problem
comment: I was put in a room where the bed head board was right next to the ice machine. I did not find this out until I was trying to sleep. I had to change rooms. The staff laughed at me when I explained that I could not sleep from people getting ice at all hours of the night. Moving rooms is also a real pain when I was half asleep. I told the meneger the next mornig and he did not do anything. Also, Iwas put in a room with two double beds instead of the king bed I ordered.

title: Great Price, Prime Location
comment: The hotel is located just a couple of blocks from Fishermans Wharf and is a nice place to stay. It is by far no resort but it meets the needs for what you need. The parking is very expensive but you can shop around and find parking at half the price just two blocks away.

everyoneShouldKnow: Suite was spotless and very comfortable.
title: Excellent Hotel
comment: Great service, hotel staff is courteous and friendly, especially John at the front desk. Clean comfortable rooms. Good food at the Belvoir Coral Cafe. Beach aross the street. Free shuttle service to and from downtown Key West. I highly recommend this hotel.

everyoneShouldKnow: Keep your expectations in check.
title: Meh...
comment: Was expecting more from this hotel, but instead got a pretty typical stay for a lower end Belvoir. The lobby is nice, but its pretty much downhill from there.

everyoneShouldKnow: Everything was awesome, including the breakfast buffet. The bar/drinks was a tadbit expensive but overall nice, mellow atmosphere.
title: Awesome Hotel and Location
comment: Great weekend getaway for family or romantically. Awsome location in the heart of Cumberland Mall, parking was complimentary and for the location, that was extremely rare. Overall, 4.7 stars.

everyoneShouldKnow: Beware the overpriced valet parking. Use one of the many other pay lots/garages within a block of the hotel.
title: Nice "date night" stay
comment: My wife & I live in the suburbs near Seattle. We had Saturday night theater tickets at the Paramount, so we decided to treat ourselves & stay in town after the show. We had never stayed at the Belvoir, but heard nice things about it so we chose to stay one night there.

everyoneShouldKnow: No soundproofing, so get ready to hear your neighbors.
title: Bring Earplugs
comment: The best thing about this hotel is it's location. It's convenient to the interstate if you need to get to Detroit, and there's a ton of restaurants, malls, movie theaters, etc around so you won't be stuck in your room. Which is good, because the walls are all made of cardboard. You can hear your neighbors like they are in your room. I had neighbors who decided to talk until 330a and the other neighbor was up at 600a watching tv, so I didn't get much sleep. I don't blame the neighbors because they weren't yelling or cranking up the tv, it's just that the walls weren't sound proofed. Despite it's good location, I'd say go somewhere else.

everyoneShouldKnow: Comfortable and Convient
title: My Stay was comfortable
comment: Overall the hotel is very nice! Needs an Inside pool! Staff was great! Had some trouble with heat in the room, told the staff on duty and instead of changing my room they said an electrician would be up in the morning.. so had to stay in cold room until the next day. The heat was still the same after a person looked at it so, went down and requested another room. The night mananger helped me... she didn't understand why I wasn't moved immediately. I didn't either!

everyoneShouldKnow: Horrendous Internet speeds--do not stay here if Internet access is important to you.
title: Fine hotel; atrocious Internet speeds
comment: Relatively new and modern hotel, with comfortable rooms. Service of staff at breakfast is outstanding--they went out of their way three days in a row to ensure I was in and out quickly.

everyoneShouldKnow: No self-parking.
title: Bad check-in experience
comment: The room was fine and the overall hotel was nice enough, but my check-in experience would make me hesitate to stay here again. When I first approached the desk, none of the agents looked up from her computer to welcome me or let me know that she'd be with me in a minute, and no one was stationed at the line reserved for Platinum and Gold BPG members, even though the shuttle driver had called ahead to let them know which guests were arriving. After a few moments, one agent, Nathalie, finally looked up to check me in. I had booked a club-level room. When Nathalie checked me in, she told me that I had been "upgraded" to a deluxe room. I asked her whether this was a room on the club level, since of course a deluxe room not on the club would be a downgrade rather than an upgrade to my reservation. She explained that they were "enhancing" the club level and were not assigning any guests to that floor, even though the reservation system of course was selling rooms as "club level". I told her that I would not pay the club level rate to stay in a non-club room (even if they would provide access to the lounge), so she called another agent over. The other agent quickly informed her that she was wrong and went ahead and assigned me to the club level room, since the "enhancements" had been completed several days before. So, in other words, Nathalie caused this whole issue for no reason by being ill-informed about the status of the enhancements to the hotel. What I resented the most, however, is that she tried to dupe me into thinking that I had received an "upgrade" when in fact I had been downgraded. She also tried to tell me that the non-club room to which she was assigning me would have the same amenities as a club room (like the bathrobe, slippers, bottled water, etc), which of course is not true--the website specifically lists these as club level room- only benefits. I found it very insulting that she would treat a customer this way when it was she who was ill-informed about basically every question I asked her.

everyoneShouldKnow: it is in a very busy area and the photo of the front is different than what is posted on Goggle maps.
title: Great Location
comment: the staff was wonderful and the hotel is in an excellent location. David & Mike D were very attentative and helpful.

everyoneShouldKnow: Gresat location

comment: The location is great!

everyoneShouldKnow: Very clean
title: Comfortable and very clean
comment: I loved the comfortable bed, and the clean room. I was surprised when I had no water to take my shower, but that was rectified in about 10 minutes. Just meant I had to skip breakfast that morning. I need "white noise" to sleep and unfortunately the AC noise is only heard in the sitting room, and not the bedroom. If this is you, make sure you ask for a room closer to Cypress than the highway.

everyoneShouldKnow: Comfortable.
title: Amazing value.
comment: Stay here every January with family of 4.

everyoneShouldKnow: Prime location!
title: Fantastic stay!
comment: This hotel is in a prime location. It is located right downtown and within walking distance of many of the great sights to see. The staff was very accommodating and took extra good care of us!

everyoneShouldKnow: Great Location
title: Got to love NOLA
comment: Excellent hotel, attentive staff, clean rooms, great amenities

everyoneShouldKnow: Exceeds expectations
title: Location
comment: In the heart of everything good.

everyoneShouldKnow: Wonderful staff!
title: Our Stay
comment: The staff at the Belvoir Atlanta are excellent. Everyone we met was friendly, helpful, competent, and engaged. This is a real strength for this hotel! The workout facility is state-of-the-art...well-equipped and very clean. Our room, however, was not up to expectations. It was very small and really in need of some remodeling. A sliding door with no lock, for example, in the bathroom. The security lock was broken. The room was also very loud. We could hear the elevator all night. Overall, not a bad experience but the rooms need some updating.

everyoneShouldKnow: Location good , rooms can be horrible
title: Took 2 moves to get a decent room!
comment: Checked in around 4:00 PM. Asked if I had a floor preference. I said no and was given a handicap room next to elevator. I immediately called down and requested a room change. Was told nothing available. Two minutes after check in??? Then was moved to a horrible room with no temperature control that worked. Got no sleep. Finally got a good room the next day.

everyoneShouldKnow: Rooms are ok.
title: Customer service was not good
comment: I love BPG program but this time I was dissappointed with the service. I stayed for two nights, at the morning on the second day I reported to the front desk that the shower was not working properly, at the evening when I returned and took a shower found out that they did not fix the shower. When I checked out the lady at the front desk was very nice and apologized for the issue even offered me an snack or a soda on the house but I told her that the only thing I wanted was that they pay attention and resolve the complaints made by the customers.

everyoneShouldKnow: A few restaurants in the mall open until 11pm. Evening Club hor d'oevres in the Bar - ask for the menu.
title: I'd give it a 4.5 only because...
comment: It was a great hotel. The only issues: 1. GoGreen - you can get a $5 coupon/day for refusing housekeeping - was weird. You couldn't use it the $5 for alcohol but food and sodas...which would have been fine, but they don't have a restaurant past 11am - just bar food. Plus, when I asked for a few towels, they gave me a little attitude. 2. No restaurant - although PF Changs is just through the doors. 3. For hor d'oevres with Club level, you have to go to the bar (not the Club Room) and select from their menu - it was not clear to me even when I asked a few times.

everyoneShouldKnow: Serviceable hotel overall, great staff - property is older and in need of a refresh.
title: Seriously needs renovation/update - serviceable - great staff
comment: I stay at this hotel often when in the area for business. it is one of the best choices in that locale. The staff is great and it has a good restaurant and bar on premises. the rooms are badly in need of an update. Beds and bathroom are clean and serviceable but the decor is tired and threadbare. The property overall does not meet the standard that i expect from a BPG property.

everyoneShouldKnow: Platinum status does not mean anything at this hotel.
title: This hotel needs better food & beverage mgmt
comment: This hotel is routinely out of diet soft drinks in the club lounge. I asked to have the food and beverage manager call me regarding this issue and they never did. Since then I used my warm welcome at the bar for a drink and snack, only to be told it would be honored this one time but in the future the front desk would need to give it to the bar directly and approve it. Why give a warm welcome ticket to the guest at all in that case? As a platinum member I think I deserve some extra attention. But as any guest I think I would expect proper food & beverage accomodations. This area needs help at the Belvoir, Augusta, Georgia.

title: Hotel is great for downtown Raleigh
comment: Stayed at this hotel in the past, never any problems. Close to the train station.

everyoneShouldKnow: Convinent to LAX
title: Convient to LAX, Good Quality
comment: We use this hotel whenever flying out of LAX next day. Good service, reasonable value.

everyoneShouldKnow: The staff was very friendly and helpful.
title: Excellent service and friendly employees
comment: We stayed at the hotel over New Years Eve with a large party of friends and family and had a terrific time. There was lots of entertainment available at the hotel including the pool area and also on the Ped Mall in Iowa City.

everyoneShouldKnow: Entrance is hard to recognize. Signage is poor.
title: Good and Bad
comment: The staff at the hotel were very good. Only 1 glitch in that they did not read their own agenda and forgot to provide driver for promised shuttle to reception on time. Room was nice but shocked at low quality TVs in room. 27 inch SD were a surprise for a hotel that claims to be 3 star. Swimming pool water was cold but spa worked nice and fitness room very good.

everyoneShouldKnow: You can't find a better hotel value near the Galleria than Belvoir Suites.
title: Wow! Amazing comfort at an even more amazing price!
comment: I booked two nights at Belvoir Suites-Galleria for an important business trip, rather on short notice. When I checked into the hotel I was greeted by very friendly, helpful staff who at once made me feel welcome. When I got to my room I was astounded at the size and luxuriious beauty of the room--so well designed and executed! My bed was perhaps the most comfortable hotel bed I've ever experienced, and I spend a large part of my year in hotels! Everything about Belvoir Suites-Galleria was delightful, even paying the bill. I've never found greater hotel value, believe me. I WILL be back!

everyoneShouldKnow: Hotel staff strive to take care of the guests.
title: Great Experience
comment: Outstanding hotel. We had a great stay and was given a room with a beautiful view of the city. Customer service was excellent.

everyoneShouldKnow: The hotel is utilitarian, but clean, friendly, and well-run.
title: A standard Belvoir, but everything done well
comment: This is a plain Belvoir hotel, nothing fancy, interesting, or unusual. But it is operated well with friendly staff, clean and nice rooms, and a good breakfast (free with the rate that I paid). It is a good location for people with business in the area. There is not much nearby for tourists, but a Metro station with quick access to downtown DC is only a block or two away. Also, the Crystal City underground shopping center is nearby, which has many restaurants and small shops. The only criticism I can think of is that it would be nice to have brighter reading lights next to the bed.

everyoneShouldKnow: Close to the airport - don't rent a car to get here, you can walk here from the car rental places!
title: Great Hotel
comment: This hotel was recently added to our corporate preferred list, and I am so happy! It's a great hotel. I got a great BPG upgrade, with a wonderful view. The Starbucks was very nice too.

everyoneShouldKnow: Huge and impersonal, needs updating.
title: Disappointment
comment: I've been a Platinum BPG member for years and have never been so slighted at a Grandbourne property before. I was not put on an BPG or Club floor. I was not offered the "go green" promotion option to gain more points. I was put in the South Tower, and it takes a full 5 minutes to get to the fitness center. My key was supposedly programmed to allow me access to the club room, but it never worked. My colleagues who have equal and less status than me were given upgrades, even though I was told there none available. The bathrooms are tiny and need updating in the worst way. There is nothing special about the behemoth of a property where no one makes you feel special to the slightest extent. I will never stay at this Belvoir again. There are many other great options of Grandbourne properties in Dallas.

everyoneShouldKnow: Don't expect a BPG Platinum recognition
title: No BPG Platinum status recognition
comment: I stayed at this hotel on 21st Jan. 2012.

everyoneShouldKnow: Management will not honor reservation made. Only give excuses
title: reservations
comment: Didn't honor reservation. Some convention excuse

everyoneShouldKnow: Renovations. Good lobby.
title: Great location but last 2 stays not up to BPG
comment: Hotel is in great location. Lobby has great vibe and is full of energy. My colleagues tell me that their rooms were nice and renovated. They don't have BPG status. I've stayed as an BPG gold the last 3 times there and my room was old, wrinkled, scratched. Not sure why they would consisently give the better rooms to the non BPG. Definitely not what I expect from Belvoir. Because of risk that I could end up on shabby floor in shabby room, I won't be staying here again until all renovations are done.

everyoneShouldKnow: Great views from upper floors, at a freeway off ramp, good places to jog/run
title: Great hotel close to NYC
comment: I needed a decent hotel, safe parking lot, and closeness to NYC. It exceeded my expectations on those and most other parameters.

title: This property needs a renovation
comment: I am not sure if this property has water damage, but their is evidence of black mold. Unfortunately, they have tried to mask this issue with bleach. All I could smell in my room was a mixture of fungus and bleach.

everyoneShouldKnow: Nickle and dimes for internet, old outdated internet and wireless is painfully slow and they charge per device! TV is out of synch.
title: Outdated
comment: The room was ok, but slow behind the modern era when it comes to internet and TV. The TV on all channels and movie rented had audio that did not match the mouth. Internet is charged which is outdated and per device even worse. Please join the modern age and get with it. This hotel comes off as a rip off for old travelers and those deperate at disneyland. Do you really need to put your customers through this?

title: My go to LAX hotel
comment: I've had consistently good experiences at this property. Quick and efficient check-in by friendly and receptive staff. Rooms are comfortable with usual Belvoir amenities (Shine bathroom products, Starbucks coffee /Tazo tea, Sweet Sleeper Bed) and fairly well kept. Club lounge is also open 7 days a week with a great breakfast spread.

everyoneShouldKnow: Best of the Best in the Magic City!
title: Welcome Back
comment: Kenya at the front desk greeted me with, "Welcome back, Mr. (my last name)" before I said hello or identified myself. Nice touch! Billy, David, and Candace also extended a warm welcome back and a "we're glad you're here" from the hotel sports bar. Gretchen in the sales department always ensures our corporate travelers are cared for beyond our expectations. The Belvoir Birmingham is our Magic City home away from home!

everyoneShouldKnow: the front desk people are outstanding
title: great staff
comment: I go there once a month or more and I have always received the best service from all the staff , I live nearby and this is my hotel of choice.

everyoneShouldKnow: the front desk person when i arrived was outstanding
title: great front desk people
comment: was there with family members great check-in,good food,beautiful oceanview room

everyoneShouldKnow: MOre attention needs to be paid to cleanliness and service
title: I stay here because it is convenient to where I do business
comment: I was very disappointed with my recent stay at this hotel:

everyoneShouldKnow: Outstanding friendly staff
title: Outstanding Service
comment: We went to Disneyland for this visit and the great service started right at the front door, the front desk was very friendly, and even though they didnt have a suite for the upgrade, (I am Platinum with Belvoir) the front desk staff had explained very nicely that they only have a few and they book very quickly, they gave me a wonderful room which was not ready but did take our bags so we could go and enjoy the park. When we retruned to the hotel the Bell man brought our bags so fast we could not believe it, he was so nice to explain about different things and plances to see while we were there for Disneyland, and the great service just kept on going...we went to the lounge for happy hour on the club floor and what a wonderful bartender she was...and a great assortment of food and drinks...the next morning we went to breakfast and again what friendly staff members and a great assortment for a continental breakfast. We were so impressed with our stay that we will make this our hotel choice for visits to come.

title: Unexpected problems
comment: This is one of several stays at this hotel. In the past, the inadequate exercise facility has been the major issue. On this visit, the television did not work and the Hotel did not have the room that I reserved. Instead of apologizing, the front desk argued that my printed reservation was just wrong. Disappointing.

everyoneShouldKnow: Slow service
title: Too slow to recover from a mistake
comment: This is not a bad hotel. It's convenient, well-situated and I've stayed there several times but in my last visit, I had a situation where the plumbing failed and I had to move rooms. Fair enough! These things happen! What got to me was that the person assigned to help me move rooms never showed up and the manager at the front desk didn't seem to care. To me it's really important that when a hotel falls short that they try extra hard to recover the situation...This one didn't!

everyoneShouldKnow: Don't depend on this hotel for internet and food.
title: Not a Good Hotel for Business Travelers
comment: As a business traveler who travels every week, I have to say that this hotel is lacking in many areas for the business traveler.

everyoneShouldKnow: The Internet consistently does not work.
title: If you need Internet to work, forget it.
comment: I come to this hotel regularly. The staff are nice, the rooms ok - but very small above the 3rd floor, and there is NO soundproofing, and the AC is temperamental at best. The worst feature, however, is the Internet facilities - wifi or wired. If there was no Internet, ok - I could get it in a local restaurant. But there is - or at least, there's supposed to be. It will tantalise you by occasionally showing a connection, but you won't hold it long enough to achieve anything. This has been going on for 6 weeks now, and has been reported many times every day - and they do nothing. So, if you need reliable Internet during your stay, go elsewhere.

everyoneShouldKnow: You won't leave feeling delighted
title: Missed opportunities
comment: I stay at this hotel almost every week yet I'm treated like a newcomer each time. The service at the front desk is usauly slow and very inconsistent, like they are just going through the motions. The rooms have been due for remodeling for a long, long time. I had a newly remodeled room on my last stay and was disappointed. Ultra bright lights, questionable decor, and 1/2 remodeled bathrooms. They missed a chance to really upgrade the property. The location is good and the amenities are nice. There are just some missed opportunities

everyoneShouldKnow: Can't beat the staff!
title: Great Business Hotel
comment: This is one of the better business hotels I've stayed at for work. Staff is excellent from the front desk to the bell staff and the Concierge level. They remember you and take care of you. Hotel is well appointed. Would recommend this to any business traveler visiting this side of Phoenix.

title: Friendly, Helpful Staff
comment: I had a great stay at the Belvoir Tribeca. The room was wonderful (the Platinum upgrade was particularly nice), but I the staff was outstanding: always pleasant, always helpful.

everyoneShouldKnow: NOt helpful
title: beware
comment: If you use their online registration, don't expect to get any of the things you put in the remarks section and ask for, like your group rate that was prearranged. They also will charge your card one month ahead of time and not refund you any money for any reason.

everyoneShouldKnow: It's a perfect place to stay!!
title: All around great hotel
comment: One of the best hotels we have stayed in. Perfect!!

title: How not to treat a Platinum
comment: Was informed I had been upgraded - great! Got to the room, normal room. Turned off the TV to go to sleep, guess what, elevator kept me up all night. Paid a really high rate for no sleep. Not the way to treat a Plat.

title: First Impressions - Not so good
comment: Just arrived too early to check in. Nice lobby, but... Receptionist didn't make any effort to try to get me in early, and the bar wanted to sell me a three-day old pastry for full price. NOT a good first impression. Hopefully things will pick up over the next several days of my stay.

title: Belvoir in name only
comment: I stay at this location only because it's close to work. There are always issues - long check-in/check-out lines, billing errors, no King-sized bed, no upgrade for platinum status, burned out light-bulbs (that don't get repaired even weeks later when I get put in the same room), bad plumbling (see light bulbs), room keys don't work, etc., etc.. In addition, the fitness eqpt is dated, the wireless signal is weak (especially on the top floors), the elevators are slow and often out of order, etc. Needs a complete overall to be brought to Belvoir standards.

everyoneShouldKnow: A very accomodating pet friendly policy.
title: Pet Friendly Policy Excellent
comment: Needing a place to stay with my dogs, this hotel was very accomodating. No additonal pet fees, good room rates and closeness to attractions made this hotel the perfect place.

everyoneShouldKnow: it's old!
title: Hotel is old
comment: This Belvoir needs an update badly. The rooms are old. Furniture is old and the carpet needs to be replaced badly. It's the only Grandbourne property in this area and i am an BPG member so i stay here. The rooms are spacious and the beds are comfortable. The staff are polite and helpful.

title: falls short
comment: I have stayed at this hotel many times and mostly found it great. This most recent stay was subpar-the hotel was being redone and there was constant noise from 7 am to 7 pm. Also, the internet was down and I had to go to the Lobby to receive a signal. So this stay fell short and I was disappointed.

title: The only thing consistent about the staff is their inconsistency
comment: I've now stayed here twice more since my last review. On both stays I got upgraded to the club floor and my room was spotless. On my first stay their was a staff member making sure the club lounge mini-fridge was re-stocked, on my second stay there was nothing in the mini-fridge, except during evening apps.

everyoneShouldKnow: Convenient location and transportation to cruise ships.
title: Too late for a good room?
comment: As many people do, we booked this hotel for one night prior to our departure on a cruise. Our day started out at 4am in California. We were bumped off of a flight, needless to say we arrived very tired and late at this property. The desk clerk actually told us we were too late for a nice room. We were given a room on the ground floor, facing the parking lot. The room (and entire hall way) had a bad odor. As a Gold Grandbourne member, it was very disappointing. Not what we had hoped for after the day we had. On the upside, this hotel is very organized in transportation to the cruise ships.

everyoneShouldKnow: No value of loyalty and poor quality.
title: Poor service and no attention to a long term BPG member.
comment: As a 50 week per year traveler and a long time Grandbourne Preferred Guest, I was surprised as to the lack of appreciation this property had for me as a long time ... loyal BPG customer. I felt that I was nickel and dimed every inch along the way during my two night stay. I was not accomodated with my placement on the club floors and not provided access to the club level lounge. I am currently gold level with Grandbourne and have already stayed 9 times in 2012. I am also Platimum and Diamond Level with other competitive chains. This made no difference in the front deck person's POV.

everyoneShouldKnow: close to LAX
title: bathroom not cleaned properly
comment: When I checked in at 11pm at night I found upon needing to use the bathroom that the toilet seat had multiple womens hair on the back side of the toilet seat.

everyoneShouldKnow: Convenient location
title: Convenient location for visiting Old San Juan
comment: The staff made it very easy to see not just Old San Juan but also other parts of Peurto Rico. Renting a car and being picked up from the hotel by Avis was a breeze!

everyoneShouldKnow: I requested that the rate be changed to the corporate rate and twice the hotel staffs told me they would follow up by either a phone call or email. I have not heard back since.
title: Follow up
comment: I've been staying at this hotel since summer of last year. Over and over again I've had to insist that I get a room based on my reservation even though I'm loyal customer. I would assume that as Platinum member, I would a better customer service but some staffs members do not even bother to follow up.

everyoneShouldKnow: The staff exceeds expectations when taking care of adults and children alike.
title: All-around family-friendly resort
comment: My mom, son and I enjoyed a wonderful two-night stay (1/19-1/21) last week and could not have been happier. This is the second time in four months that I have enjoyed your resort and am pleased to have discovered it; my mom was a first-time visitor and really enjoyed her time at the resort.

everyoneShouldKnow: Have to pay for internet.
title: Business trip
comment: I found the room to be small. There was no refridgerator or microwave. The iron leaked water. The continental breakfast was lacking. Had to pay for internet usage. I was going to talk to the staff while I was there but heard another guests talking about their difficulties, decided not to. Staff was just deflecting to maintenance department, didn't accept responsibility for anything, so decided to just wait. Belvoir quality just wasn't there.

everyoneShouldKnow: If you self park, pay close attention to how you get to the lobby. Locating your car can be difficult.
title: Surprising view
comment: Despite the inland location, I was pleasantly surprised by the sweeping ocean view. It's apparent this hotel has a history of use, but you can't beat the value.

everyoneShouldKnow: Nice hotel, easy to get to
title: Nice hotel
comment: Nice hotel, comfortable bed. Good circulation. Clean room. Easy to check in and out. Although there during snow storm, still clean.

everyoneShouldKnow: Very dirty and short staffed and the food was not fresh.
title: cleanliness/food quality
comment: Our room was very dirty and dusty. The bathroom was grossly soiled, especially the toilet. The food in the club lounge was obviously not fresh, as the fruit was rotting on the plate. The hot foods were cold. There was no bottled water available in the lounge.I have never written a bad review about a Grandbourne property before as they have always been excellent.

everyoneShouldKnow: below par
title: Needs Improvement
comment: I recently stayed at this property and was underwhelmed. First, I went out for a run and many hotels have water available when you get back. This property didn't and when I asked I was told I could buy a bottle from the store. second, One night I ordered room service, the pasta with sausage, and couldn't believe for $21 I got a tiny and bland meal. At checkout I mentioned both issues and the agent could have cared less. I expected more from this type of property, especially as a Gold member, but they didn't deliver.

everyoneShouldKnow: District Restaruant is amazing!
title: Excellent Belvoir
comment: The moment we walked into the Hotel I was able to feel at ease. It has a calm and tranquil environment considering how big the lobby is. The lobby is very modern, clean and spacious. As a GOLD was upgraded to the BPG floor without asking. The room was spacious and typical Belvoir Style. The district bar is very good. Saturday nights they have live Jazz which is very nice. Overall an awesome Belvoir very close to a lot of the major attractions that downtown Phoenix has to offer.

everyoneShouldKnow: Be very careful if you book on line.
title: I had two issues with rates
comment: We booked our reservation on line so were told we did not qualify for free breakfast buffet. Also our credit card was charged for 25.00 in addition to the room rate for incidentals. Since the room was paid on line the front desk could not even tell us our bill when we left. We were told there were NO additional charges so why the 25.00? The room and house staff are great and we love the hotel but will never book on line again.....

title: Problemas
comment: No hot water for 8 nights even after two calls to the front desk to fix it (it wasn't frigid, just luke warm but hey, for $256/night, that's not ok).

everyoneShouldKnow: Great location and easy drive into Hollywood
title: Average hotel, great value and location
comment: The hotel was pretty standard for Belvoirs, and possibly below average for LA. Although was a great stay. The pool did leave a bit to be desired, but the staff was very friendly and helpfull. The location was excelent.

everyoneShouldKnow: Location is great!
title: Perfect Location
comment: My husband and I stayed here New Year's 2011 and it was perfect so we brought the family this time.

everyoneShouldKnow: club lounge closed on weekends
title: good airport hotel
comment: we arrived at 2 am after a very long flight, stayed 2 days just to recover jet lag before another 8 hr flight,,,as a platinium BPG member, we expected a decent room, but was put into a room opposite the lift and open plan club room, this area is always very noisy, we asked and was changed to another room, at 3 am. the second room was clean and comfortable a bit like ralph lauren style, however the tv was broken. Exhausted we went to sleep. As always the bed was fantastic as expected, the bed and pillows were great as we have come to expect., The free breakfast for club guests in the club lounge was closed and we were told we could eat in the main dinning room in the morning but due to our late arrival we skipped breakfast, then we changed rooms again as tv could not be fixed. At this point we were very tired and dissappointed at been moved around the hotel. The printer in the club loung was broken so had to resort to the link room,. my wife and i can understand how various problems arise in hotels but felt we were very let down up at this point. Until we met Marvin and George behind front desk, these two gentlemen tolally restored my faith in the JFK Belvoir . Before i had even started to tell them of our woes, Marvin had offered us a complementary dinner in the restaurent that evening, i have to say that we thourghly enjoyed dinner.Friendly courteous and lovely food,..Marvin restored the status quo here, and i would return knowing he was still there.

everyoneShouldKnow: excellent if they key cards work
title: Room access
comment: I checked in late. The front desk clerk did not acknowledge the BPG status or hotel BPG benifits. When I got into my room (at 12:30 am, late check in) the key would not work. Security let me into room but told me not to leave until morning or I could not get back into the room. At 7 am the front desk gave me new key cards. Still could not get in so they sent maintance. They played with the door reprograming it several times. Finally worked, but when I came back from my meeting I could not get in. So they replaced the battery in the door. Worked for a short while. They then replaced the door assembly, which worked for about 1 day. The entire time I was there, right to check out I was never sure if I could get into my room. This was to bad as otherwise my stay would have generated excellent reviews.

everyoneShouldKnow: Very easy to Times Square and theaters
title: Best view of New York !
comment: Stay here every trip to Jersey. The hotel is the best in the area, including NYC. Getting the ferry on the property to the bus that takes you to times square and the theaters is extremely convient, espically when it is snowing. The view is outstanding!

everyoneShouldKnow: Rooms are nice and clean but good only for a 1 night stay as housekeeping does not see to your room unless you call. Does not have club room and no breakfast for BPG members.
title: Won't stay here next time.
comment: Arrived on a Fri. checked in, had to listen to a small dog bark next door for 3.5 hrs. When I went out& mentioned to front desk I was asked if I wanted to move rooms. ie I was not the one making the noise & why would they put someone next to the room with the dog? The hotel was not busy. Dog still barking 4 hrs later. Sat am I noticed 2 doors down 3 glasses left outside a door. They were still there when I checked out Sun am. Returned Sat at 5 pm and housekeeping still hadn't been there. I had to call to have some one come up to empty the trash can & replace towels. Bad weather this weekend and had to walk in the driveway (avoiding the dog mess) as the sidewalks were icey and had not been salted to remove ice. BPG members are usually treated better at most Belvoir hotels.

everyoneShouldKnow: Friendly and helpful staff.
title: Great People!
comment: From the folks at the front desk to the many others you meet during a hotel stay, this was one of the best experiences we have ever had at any Grandbourne location. This made our weekend very special. Thanks to everyone.

title: Under-rated
comment: The restaurant was far above expectations. The lobby could be bigger. The room was quite nice and the view from the hotel room was definitely under-rated.

everyoneShouldKnow: lack of customer service.
title: Dissappointing service..Several stays.
comment: This is truly my first review as a 8 year Platinum member, But I feel I must post this. I live in PA. Fly out of BWI for the price and convenience. I have yet to stay here and not have several issues with the service and room. It really is such a disappointment. I can give you multiple, multiple reasons but I will keep this short. You will never get anything, even a bottle of water or snack from the lounge after 9:30 pm or a consistent room. So you better check in before 7 ..Management tends to be rude, errogant and un-accommodating in which I am really disappointed in you all. Grandbourne, Please step in here.

everyoneShouldKnow: Great Value!
title: Great Value!
comment: For the amount that is being payed this Belvoir does it's job. Self parking is efficient and check in is always a breeze! I travel frequently to this hotel and already know that the check in process is friendly, quick and efficient. Rooms are good size and balconies make it nice to hang out in your room for a bit. Good value for the money being payed!

everyoneShouldKnow: It is a big complex
title: Great location, great hotel
comment: While driving from west to east coast, I needed a place to stay for a night. Called BPG and they recommended this hotel because of its proximity to I-20. Staff was very helpful when I got turned around in downtown Birmingham (at midnight). Thanks again for the hospitality!

everyoneShouldKnow: Exceptional service
title: Great stay
comment: Hotel service was exceptional.

everyoneShouldKnow: Lovely grounds, spacious rooms
title: Quality Stay, Great Location
comment: Access to the beach is what made this hotel stand out for us. Simply grab your stuff and walk across the street to a great beach with all water activities right there. Hotel pool/hot tub was a perfect end to the day. The suite facilities were great for our adult family of five. We used two rooms so everyone had sleeping space; however, the pull outs are not nearly as comfortable as the bed.

everyoneShouldKnow: The staff and service are excellent!
title: Enjoyed our stay
comment: The staff at this hotel is great. They are very helpful and friendly and are always willing to help with any requests.

everyoneShouldKnow: The renovation saves this hotel
title: The renovation helped
comment: I have been staying at this property for several months now and for the first time was upgraded to a newly renovated guest room. The renovation did the room a world of good - new paint, carpets, artwork, bathroom - the whole 9 yards. I was beginning to tire of the worn nature of the hotel but these changes have made it worth staying at again.

everyoneShouldKnow: It is really just a Belvoir 4-Points in disguise.
title: 4-Points in Disguise
comment: 1. The address provided on the website isn't GPS compatible. I ended up approximately a mile from where I should have been. I called the hotel and they were aware of this and gave me directions to the hotel.

everyoneShouldKnow: Room was clean and comfortable.
title: Your Personnel
comment: The only reason for the 3 star rating is due to your personnel. The staff member checking us in was very rude and acted as if we were bothering her. We were told our pet couldn't be left alone in the room and we have no problem with the rule. Upon returning we talked with another guest who informed she knew nothing about the rule and left two dogs in her room. The room itself was clean and the view wonderful which brings me to another point. We were at Club Level but the staff member failed to give us any information about any amenties, especially the breakfast.

everyoneShouldKnow: Great location but needs renovation badly
title: Bathroom Very Disappointing
comment: The bathroom need a complete renovation. Cracked tiles, rusty faucets, stains on the walls and the floor, stains and cracks on the vaity, etc.

title: As long as you don't need a bed, fine hotel.
comment: I stayed for the first time last week. The room is fine, though no seat in the wheelchair access shower. The bed was awful; lumpy, unsupportive, noisy. There was no bottled water in the room.

everyoneShouldKnow: Don't stay unless thee is nothing else available
title: This hotel is not worth staying at
comment: TV didn't work

everyoneShouldKnow: Fantastische Lage, super Personal
title: Fantastische Lage
comment: Bin mit dem Belvoir Pasadena sehr zufrieden.

everyoneShouldKnow: If you are a Platinum member forget it. There are better places to stay nearby
title: Lots of stays here but never again
comment: The utter lack of recognition for a Platinum member is amazing! Here's how to kill your hotel with Platinum guests - start with sending a message suggesting we spend 30% more for a "club level" room. If it's available Platinum is supposed to get upgraded. At check-in be told you've been upgraded (but not to the best available) because access to your floor is restricted. Of course the room is the same size, amenities are the same, and it is exactly the same as non-"restricted" floors, but HEY! it's an upgrade! By the way, that "welcoming gift"? You better want points because the front desk staff is going to give you an alternative by asking. Go to your room and find they've ignored your requests for extra towels and pillows. (This is guaranteed or compensated in other plans folks!) Now ask for those additional items and have the person delivering only the towels drop them off and just leave without a word. What a stupid guest, you should have KNOWN those extra pillows were in a bag in the closet (where they may have been for the last 6 months for all you know.) Check the next day, and find out there's an entire floor of much larger, nicer rooms on the executive level. And guess what? They are available for your entire stay. Now be told you can reserve that level next time (at additional cost of course.) So much for the upgrade, but we're not done. Now if you really want to put a dagger in the hotel's Platinum heart, have one of your keys not work. Then send your spouse down with your Platinum key-jacket to get one that does. Can you see this coming? The staff person keeps the non-working key and says you need your ID (that's back up in the room) because they want to be security conscious. The Platinum jacket isn't enough because you might have found or stolen it. It doesn't matter that they talked to you less than 24 hours ago and heard your complaints then. Please, Platinum member, we must abuse you just a bit more. Stayed here more than 10 years and probably close to 50 times but I'm done. I recommend you stay away from here if you are an elite member who knows how a property is SUPPOSED to treat you. They didn't even send a manager to talk to me.

everyoneShouldKnow: Go to the restaurant in the morning. Patercia is a wonderful person and makes my stay more enjoyable.
title: Different night manager better stay!
comment: Night manager was very helpful. She was very nice and respectful. Thank you Bobbie.

everyoneShouldKnow: Beware of the rooms
title: Do not let the lobby fool you
comment: The rooms in this hotel are horrible. I would have done better in a Motel 6. Paint was peeling from the bathroome ceiling and the bathtub had was rusted where the drain pipe was located. As a platinum member I was appalled at the condition of this hotel. I am now considering switching brand loyalties

everyoneShouldKnow: Great service every employee was very helpful check in was the quickest that I have had anywhere.
title: Great Hotel
comment: First time we have stayed there will be back we did the derby dinner package,everything was handled perfectly. great customer service.

everyoneShouldKnow: clean, friendly staff, Nice location
title: Wonderful Stay
comment: This is my 4th or 5th stay in the past few years. I enjoy my stay every time. I have stayed friends with some of the staff. They are very friendly and try to make my stay wonderful. I was upset that I didn't have a fridge in my room But upon request they put one in :)

everyoneShouldKnow: Nice hotel, good location for convention go-ers, but have dinner somewhere else
title: The restaurant service needs attention.
comment: The hotel is well-appointed and comfortable. Room service was prompt and the food is good quality and served in generous portions. However, my experience with the restaurant service in the dining room was poor. I waited by myself for 5 minutes before any of the staff acknowledged me or even made eye contact. Waitstaff had little knowledge of the specials or how food was to be prepared, even after I asked them to check. Water goblet was filled for the first time half way through the meal. I also do not like paying extra for in-room WiFi service. You don't charge guests for using the hot water, do you? WiFi is your infrastructure. Not likely to stay at this Belvoir property again.

everyoneShouldKnow: Major (and must needed) renovation in progress
title: Wait until Renovation is over
comment: Stayed here one night January 2012. Started by waiting for over 45 minutes for the shuttle bus from O'hare (every other bus picked up 2 or 3 times by the time the Belvoir arrived). Major renovation going on at this hotel. Entire lobby and atrium is blocked off by black plastic as it is gutted to concrete slab. I believe some of the rooms have been renovated. But most have not and they are about 8 years past due. Many people who were staying more than one night were checking out to go somewhere else. Staff seemed very disenterested and extremely slow. As a part of the renovation they have set up some type of ventialation system which involved most ot the out side windows on one floor being open with plastic tubes hanging out making a constant and very loud flapping sound. Honestly should have just shut down this property while they renovate. Very bad brand experience.

title: Front Desk Service
comment: Your front desk staff were very helpful. My iPhone charge was not working and they let me borrow one that a previous guest had left behind. Within 5 minutes of making an inquery , someone brought one to the front desk from lost and found. I returned it upon check out. Thanks to your staff

everyoneShouldKnow: Overall friendly staff but the rooms need a refresh as the furniture and carpets are tired.
title: Room Change Needed
comment: Checked in and was initially put exactly where my BPG profile says I don't want to be - next to the elevators. In addition they tried to put me in a room not on the club level. After an immediate complaint, I was moved to the club level in a room that was not downsized because space was taken away by the elevators. With over 40% of the rooms empty that night, why would they even try to put me in the first room?

everyoneShouldKnow: Customer Service was not very good and Bring your Checkbook
title: Customer Service Was NOT GOOD!
comment: I stayed at this hotel last week for a convention that was held there. The convention brought over 200 people to this hotel and service was not good at all. Some staff were rude and not helpful when I called down to the front desk. Drinks were BEYOND EXPENSIVE.... We had an Awards Dinner 1 of the nights and had to purchase our drinks. A very small watered-down mixed drink was $11 and a can of coke was $6. I don't mind paying for service if it is GOOD Service. I was not pleased with the service at all. The restaurant inside the hotel was closed one of the days at lunch time, and another day had a very long wait time because they had 1 server to help everyone. I would think if you have a convention scheduled and this many people reserved to come to a convention in a room directly across from this restaurant in the hotel, you would schedule enough people to accommodate at least a portion of the people there. One of the mornings for breakfast, we went to the same restaurant and ordered 2 omelets for $50. Very very over-priced..... It was a very nice hotel, but sadly I would not recommend this place to anyone.

title: Customer Service Lacking
comment: After many stays at Grandbourne Hotels, I was really surprised at the lack of concern or care from the staff at Belvoir Marina in San Diego. When I asked to switch rooms, no one even bothered asking why or what they could do. The bar at the Bay Tower was a MESS at 10pm. Bottles, drinks, everywhere, but no one to take our order. After waiting 10 minutes, we mentioned at the front desk that we weren't able to get a drink. The response was "Oh, they are closed." No, empathy what so ever. My first room didn't have a working internet connection and all rooms are wired connections not wireless. Finally, the Bay Tower is dated. Rooms are a good size, but it all feels old. Overall, it was an unimpressive stay made worse by a staff who seemed as if they couldn't care less.

everyoneShouldKnow: The staff was great!
title: The hotel staff was excellent!
comment: My boyfriend and I drove down from Ohio to see a concert, upon arrival we found out the concert was cancelled, we were very upset. Brittney and the other hotel receptionist were absolutely great, they helped to make the stay more enjoyable! They gave us several recommendations of things to do in the city, as well as giving us directions and answering any questions we had. The shuttle service was very convenient and the rooftop bar was an added bonus. The room was clean and very nice. The staff and the features of this hotel made our stay very satisfying!

title: Disappointing
comment: The Orlando Downtown was disappointing. The facilities are not what I expected but the staff was very nice. Room service was expensive and the quality of the food was not up to par. Breakfast in the Cafe was good and the staff was very accomodating. Overall, the rooms were small and the hotel needs to be updated.

title: Staff not helpful
comment: I checked out with cash, and after week, the deposit held on my credit card had not been released. I have been stayed with to a lot places, and the deposit is always released right after I checked out.

everyoneShouldKnow: Get to know Sissy
title: Great staff
comment: My wife and I visit Kauai twice a year and

title: Nice Hotel on Milwaukee's West Side
comment: This is a nice hotel, very close to shopping it has a great pool and a decent, affordably priced restaurant. A great option, if you want to be a little bit out of downtown. Parking is free, which is always nice. It does seem to be pretty popular with families. Many of the times I have been here you could hear children shouting or running around late at night, but security does a decent job getting them in bed.

everyoneShouldKnow: Best value for the price
title: The best value in Chicago
comment: Our recent stay started with great customer service from Madilyn and continued throughout our short visit. Best service for the money.

everyoneShouldKnow: Great Location and Spacious Rooms.
title: Wonderful Staff, Great Locale & Spacious Rooms
comment: I stayed here for a week and enjoyed every minute. The rooms are very spacious and the higher floors have incredible views of the city and the bay. The club lounge is quite small, but they more they make up for it with an incredible breakfast buffet including made to order omelettes and lots of fresh fruit.

title: Huge resort with lots to do!
comment: We have stayed at this property and a couple of times and loved it! Shula's Steak House was great! Location for Getting to and from the theme parks is hard to beat! A+ Will be back!

title: Clean Modern Hotel, Great Location, Iffy Service
comment: The lobby and our room looked great, everything was sparkling, polished & clean and the location is fantastic. You can see the Market from the corner and there is shopping, the convention center, a movie theater and more all within a 1 minute walk.

everyoneShouldKnow: It is usually nicer on the inside than it appears.
title: Hotel needs better cleaning
comment: As a regular guest at this hotel I don't normally have these issues as I stay in the Preferred guest side of the hotel. This specific time they were full and my platinum status resulted in a room quite far from the lobby that had opened water bottles, vanity not wiped down and security latch on the sliding door broken. All of these things were disappointing and made me realize how much more I actually get as a Platinum guest.

everyoneShouldKnow: Staff not helpful at all
title: Staff does not care about your issue
comment: About $1000 deposit held on my credit card not released one week after I checked out. I called several times but multiple persons who answered my calls showed little interest resolving my issue. The first time I was told I need wait another several days; the second time I was told who entered the transaction would contact me but it never happened; the third time I was told that my inquiry would be directed to Research Department and I need to wait another 7 to 10 business days to get answer.

everyoneShouldKnow: very nice
title: 2nd stay
comment: 2nd time here, nice,clean, close to everything,staff courteous,knowledgable

everyoneShouldKnow: Easy indoor access to the prudential mall and all the eating and shopping it offers.
title: Club Level
comment: We had a very smooth check-in and found our room to be very nice, liked the furniture leaving enough room to move around, shower setup ok but all nice and fresh looking, great view and liked the internet for free in the club room.

title: The Hotel is Great
comment: No one came to clean to my room, I had to track down the cleaning lady and request clean towels for my room, no sheet change, no shower scrub.

everyoneShouldKnow: The parking garage is filthy and scary!
title: Highly Disappointed!!!
comment: I booked my reservation on the BPG website. When I got to the hotel, they couldn't find my reservation at all. They only gave me a room because I had a printed out copy of my confirmation. Then they didn't acknowledge me as a preferred guest. They didn't even want to honor the room rate that I received. Thank GOD I had a printed out slip. They then put me in a tiny room, with Shower only (which I did not book) and the comforter had a black stain. I was totally embarrassed!! I will never go back there again!!

everyoneShouldKnow: Nice
title: I enjoyed the comfort of my room
comment: I really enjoyed the comfort of my room. The beds were comfortable. I could adjust the heating and/or cooling to my desired temperature.

everyoneShouldKnow: Great location, great staff, accomodations were excellent.
title: Everything was wonderful
comment: This is our first time at the Belvoir. Everything was beyond expectations. Staff was so pleasant and helpful. Price was super and the view spectacular. Loved this place and look forward to returning. Clean, comfortable, perfect.

everyoneShouldKnow: Great parking, great location in terms of being central to downtown venues in Indy. Staff was extremely cordial.
title: They Were Outstanding
comment: I have been a Grandbourne member for over 10 years, and I've never felt so special during a visit. The staff was outstanding; made me feel extremely welcome, and appeared genuinely happy to provide service. It was impressive. I know it was the week before the superbowl that I visited, so they may have been tuning up for the big weekend. Whatever the reason, they performed quite well.

title: this hotel exceeded my expectations
comment: great customer service. As a platinum member the manager went out of his way to recognize my status and upgraded me to a suite . Room and all facilies were top notch. The receptionist was very pleasnant and couldn't be more helpful.
